121121.content:
"I'm not sure, When I banished him back to the demonic realm I thought I was sealing him there" Raven grew more and more serious her body trembling "But I am still a conduit for him, my powers are still coupled with his existence. I want to know if he is banished or actively seeking power again. If he may be assembling a force in the demon realm to invade our dimension again, if he has a way to return or... if he will find a way to use me again..."

Starfire sat silently on her pillow staring at Raven unsure how to comfort her friend. Jinx just looked down at what little tea was left in her cup reminded of her own dark past and life of wrong doing. Little was said between the girls for a while as dark pasts and evil intentions weighed on their minds. At last of all people Jinx spoke up in comfort of Raven.

"Don't worry, we'll help you handle this" Jinx tried to reassure her doing her best to look at Raven with compassion. Starfire smiled brightly in support and nodded at Raven.

"Thank you both" Raven allowed herself to smile "Now lets all join hands, I'll chant the contact spell, you both just need to clear your minds and keep focus on the relay stone on that pedestal"

The three heroine sat around the circle with linked hands as Raven chanted. Slowly a pale light grew inside the hole in the stone larger and larger till it made contact with the sides. As the light reached the sides of the stone it shifted to a dark purple and the stone stood up swiftly balancing on one side. Raven's eyes began to glow too shifting to a lighter shade of purple and the light in the stone shifted to match. As Raven chanted she kept concentrating on the spiritual signature of her contact and leading the stone along with her tuning it to her intended target like a dial on a radio. The Symbols on their hands started to glow as well, the light from each symbol making contact between hands then wrapping around their arms like vines towards the symbols on the chests. The growing lines of light encircled the symbols on the chest without touching them and continued on after making a full loop around the chest runes and on towards the other set of linked hands.

The Stone in the center began to float slightly turning in sync with the speed of the glowing lines wrapping around the three girls. Starfire and Jinx were a little unnerved by the lines progressing across them but held their focus as Raven had instructed. The light in the stone was now a dull pink and a light haze of the same color was emanating from it. Small pink sparkles and a light vapor seemed to obscure the stone slightly.

"Almost made contact" Raven paused her chanting to inform the girls "When it connects don't be so alarmed you lose your focus or we'll have to start over"

Each girl nodded silently as Raven took up her chant again. The color of the stone and the effects around it shifted to a brighter pink but with a more flesh colored hue filtered in. The vapor around the stone seemed to thicken and grew heavy as the haze seemed to flow out of the stone and down the edges of the pedestal with weight. Starfire and Jinx could start to smell the vapor as it grew thicker in the air. It was a dank pungent smell with an underlying trace of brimstone. Starfire and Jinx were thankful the smell seemed to stay low in the air without clouding it too much as it was difficult to think straight as the light traces of the musky yet heady smell were already making their heads spin slightly. Suddenly a voice broke the deadpan chanting of Raven and make Starfire jump slightly almost losing her focus.

"Who dares interrupt the slumber of Talarok the master of satia- eh?" The voice trailed off "Little mortal? Is that you I sense?"

"Yes it is me" Raven replied ending her chant "Pandora" Raven looked at Jinx and Starfire briefly to remind them to avoid using real names.

"Ah yes, Pandora, it is you" The deep voice mused "I almost didn't recognize you, there is some interference with your spiritual presence... or is it possibly, you've invited guests...?"

"Indeed" Raven spoke clearly and flatly trying to show no expression in her voice.

"So you have!" The demonic voice celebrated "I take it then you have decided to accept my offer to show you more about this demon you are seeking. Then you are also going to tell me why a mortal so young and innocent is so invested in Trigon?"

"Absolutely not" Raven's voice grew slightly unable to refute the question entirely monotone "As I have explained before that information is not being offered at this time" Jinx and Starfire continued to look at the stone with all the focus they could spare are they kept stealing glances of Raven's stolic flat emotionless face as she communed with the disembodied voice emanating from the stone.

The voice chuckled slightly "Little mortal I do not wish to indulge these cat and mouse games forever" The was a slight pause as the voice continued with a thoughtful hum "You know if you are going to access the information I have you must start making greater concessions than just the name of who you seek or agreeing to let me share your eyes on these meetings, very pretty friends you have brought by the way" The voice added with another chuckle. Starfire and Jinx almost looked at Raven in shock as the connection wavered slightly.

"Relax now young mortals" The voice cautioned them "I can see this link is tenuous with such easily distracted participants Pandora. I think we can find a new arrangement for greater information however. But first allow me to provide a bit of assistance..." The voice trailed off and there was some silence for a time. Jinx and Starfire both took the brief pause to each shoot Raven harsh and inquisitive looks respectively for the revelation the demon could see them. Raven didn't respond trying to keep her eyes trained on the stone.

"Hey, red" The voice returned "you with the green eyes, mind grabbing that mirror on the table beside you?" Raven's expression grew concerned, she hadn't looked at the table, how could he see the mirror on it. Starfire looked up at Raven questioning if she should. "It's alright you can break your focus now, I took care of it" the voice softly encourage.

Raven's expression turned to shock. "Don't pick it up!" Raven called out to Starfire who was still wondering if she should do as the voice was demanding. Quickly Raven closed her eyes and turned groping for her bed yanking the cover off it once she found it. Raven turned back and opened her eyes to throw the cover over the stone. "He established a link on his side so we don't need to focus to keep the link open but that means he can remotely view anything in sight of the stone"

"do ho ho ho" The voice let out a boisterous laugh "very clever of you my little sorceress"

"Friend Ra---er Pandora?" Starfire tentatively asked still trying to look at the lump in the covers unsure if she still needed to focus "What is happening?"

"You can stop focusing, the link is solid now, as I said" Raven's attempt to remain monotone was faltering as she was flustered by this development "With the stone active like this he could have viewed my room and looked for clues as to who I am... I should have been more careful and done this somewhere like the basement"

"I see so you need to be careful not to give him any hints, even outside there may be something he could use as a mirror in view of your eyes to see you" Jinx put together

"Indeed!" The voice chuckled on "Up till now this resourceful little vixen has been very careful to hide anything useful to me even when I tried to fool her by barraging for use of her eyes she was careful not to have anything in her field of vision that gave away who she is or that maybe reflective. Unfortunately the stone only replicates the area surrounding it not spirits within it, and you were quick enough to cover it before I spied any clues... I was too cocky and gave away I had a link..." the voice snickered harder on that last comment.

"You were hoping I'd call one of them by name or have an emotional outburst strong enough for you to overwhelm me" Raven flatly stated again regaining her composure

"He he... guilty" The voice replied

"Should we be worried here?" Jinx relaxed no longer needing to maintain the focus "Seems like you're not as 'in control' as you led us to believe"

"It's fine" Raven quickly countered. "There will be no more surprises"

"Oh I'm not so sure about that..." the voice returned with enthusiasm. "I think it's time we get down to business, and since you have put your foot down on my payment of information we need a new bargain if you want to continue from where we left off..."

"What is it you want?" Raven kept her clam and stated the question as evenly as she could still anticipating the worst.

"Well you've proven a fun challenge so far, keeping your cards close to your chest, out smarting some of my better gambits, you even fulfilled my request to perform the relay with two guests and still thwarted me using it to spy your identity. And since you are well aware of my intentions and still invited two friends but didn't bother to obscure their faces I can only assume they don't have any magical essence to corrupt or twist so you must not be living with other magic users as I assumed..."

"Just get to the point Talarok" Raven demanded

"Heh...Ok have it your way" The voice shrugged "If you want to continue this deal...
121121.title: Jinx and Starfire agree to help

choices: Jinx and Raven must fight back
Raven and Jinx awake in Talarock's lair.
1211211.content:
... then you must let me use one of your friends'mouths to speak." The voice said after spending a minute calculating the least objectionable demand possible.

"What?" Raven said. Slightly startled by this rather unexpected request. "Why? You can communicate with us just fine through the ritual."

"Yes, well..." Talarok mused out loud. "Maintaining the ritual from my end requires a considerable effort and a great deal of concentration, were I to be able to both view and speak through a more physical channel in the mortal realm, the burden would be lessened. Your pink-haired friend looks suitable-"

"No! N.O. I am not getting posessed by a demon!" Jinx yelled at the relay stone as Raven shot her a cold look to remind her that getting agitated will only make matters worse.

"My dear girl!" The demon said with a laugh and a voice as soothing as a creature of ultimate evil could convey. "The process could hardly be considered outright posession! It's more like.. becoming a miniature focal point for my esscence. Just enough for me to convey my message verbally-"

"She said no, Talarock." Raven said, trying her best to suppress the notion that she was defending her friends.

A sigh seemed to eminate from the stone, temporarily raising the temperature in the room about five degrees

"Look, Pandora. You are the first person from the mortal realm to contact me in millenia; and while I do thank you for the opportunity to conduct buisness once again, you are far to unwilling to pay the price for the information you seek- or any price, for that matter. If you continue to refuse to offer up anything from your side of the table, I'm afraid that your going to have to take your buisness elsewhere. And I assure you, no one in the lower circles is as patient as I am when it comes to these sort of deals-"

"I shall serve as the dark one's voice!" Starfire suddenly spoke up.

"No!" Raven said, no longer able to fully hide her concern for her companions. "You don't have to do this!"

"But Ra- Pandora, Trigon is a terrible foe who destroyed our world once before. If he is able or will be able return, then we might not be able to undo the damage he will surely cause."

"Red's right, Pandora." Talarok added, trying his best not to sound to excited at the surprise presence of a volunteer and finally understanding why exactly Pandora was so interested in learning about Trigon. "If you know anything about him, which you have proved to me you do, then you must know that he can easily turn the mortal realm to ash and eradicate all life on Earth should he ever return to his full power."

Raven closed her eyes. Shutting herself off from the world while her inner selves rigorously debated the pros and cons about the situation at hand. She had sworn to herself before first making contact that she would not under any circumstances sacrifice anyone to get the information she needed; but Starfire was offering to take on a risk all on her own. She was also no feeble minded fool who would submit as soon as a demon tried to apply any pressure; but at the same time, Starfire was emotional and far too trusting to be dealing with these... creatures. After two intermissions and the Personification of Anger getting thrown out of the meeting for violent misconduct, the Inner Ravens agreed, at a vote of 8 to 7, that the current risk brought on by the situation at hand was outweighed by the need to know if Trigon was making another attempt at invading earth.

"Alright," Raven finally said as her eyes pried open. " 'Red' will surve as your conduit."

"Thank you, friend Pandora," Starfire said with a nod. "I shall not fail you."

"Wonderful!" Talarok's sudden good mood was causing the mist invading Raven's room to rise slightly, causing Jinx to cough. "Approach the relay stone, girl. Look deep into the crevices, and clear your mind of all unneeded thoughts."

Starfire nodded and began making her way to the stone. As she approached, a litany of unclean words spilled into the room, causing the mist in the room to darken and thicken further. Raven was tempted to destroy the stone here and now before things got out of hand, but she had to know if Trigon was still out there, waiting for the time to be right. The very thought of her father still weilding some level of power forced her to stay her hand, and watch as the seen infront of her played out.

A few moments later, the stream of demonic profanity ceased it's flow, and Starfire turned around to face the others.

"A-hem." Starfire cleared her throat and hummed a few bars, as if testing the ranges of her voice.

"I suppose this will do," Talarok said, evidentially deciding to stick with the most monotone voice Starfire was capable of.

"Yes, well, you got what you wanted Talarok, now answer my question: is Trigon still powerfull? Where is he? And is he recovering?"

"Very well, Pandora, you have earned the right to some answers. First, Trigon is indeed still a force to be reckoned with in the lower circles; though he isn't the policy jaugernnaut that he used to be. Second, I don't know where he is, he's only been acting through proxies. Third, I would deffinately say that he's slowly getting back to the status that he once held-"

While Raven listened to these revalations in dumbstruck horror, Jinx noticed that Starfire's voice was slowly getting deeper with each word that was said. Not wanting to stay behind long enough for a possessed alien to tear her to shreds, the pink-haired hexer made a move for the door, only to find that the mist had condensed so much as to prevent her from pushing past it to the door.

"-And fourth! My dear Pandora, you might have the opportunity to meet him very soon!"

"Azeroth, Metrion-" Raven attempted to form a shield around herself, but it was already too late.

"Sarbles!" Starfire yelled out, summoning an enormous vortex into the room that began pulling Jinx and Raven into the swirling black and red beyond.

"This is your fault!" Was the last thing that Raven heard before the vile energy overwhelmed her.
1211211.title: Bad idea...

choices: Talarok attacks again from a new direction
12112111.content:
The Dark mist welled up whipping around as the center of the room depressed and slowly split open to reveal a red glowing portal. The Mist shifted and swelled like a tiny sea in Raven's room swallowing Raven and washing her into the vortex.

"Azerath Met-Guff" Raven tried to cast a spell but the mist surged over her with a mind of it's own determined to keep her from fighting back. A black whip like force pushed back the mist as Raven cracked her magic attack at the dark mass trying to buy herself time "Shu'kuru H'jara Tu--- Bah!" Raven began casting once more but the mist returned in greater force swallowing her and tossing her about violently to keep her disoriented.

"This is your fault!" Raven heard before the sea of mist pulled her head under. Talarok turned to the outburst in surprise to see Jinx still unaffected. At her feet the pink energy of her power swirled and lapped at her feet combating the mist from pulling her into the flow as well. Long tendrils of pink and thick patches of mist struck at each other like cobras all around Jinx. Starfire's face now growing dark and sinister smiled and let out a blusterous laugh her voice now exactly like the demon had sounded before.

"An etheral child! So many surprises you've got up your sleeve Pandora!" Starfire grinned wickedly at Jinx as her eyes clouded with dark swirls and her pupils began glowing red. "You're not a witch or even a true magic caster but your power is pure energy tied to your very being that you can manipulate with thought! You'll make a fine servant."

Starfire lifted a hand to cast a spell at Jinx as red glowing runes spread down her arms across her skin to her hands. Jinx was by no means defenseless however and threw up her own attack as a pink blade broke loose from her protective paling and cut through the mist at Starfire. The demon switched it's stance and knocked the attack away with Starfire's bare hand, the stray pink energy cutting into Raven's bed making it crack and fall to pieces with a gash cut into it.

"Incredible!" Talarok laughed with unrestrained enthusiasm "You manipulated the object's composition at a level beyond mortal understanding and altered it's fate to one of destruction!"

"Well they don't call me Jinx for nothing!" Jinx quipped and brought her hands together into a clap aimed over the possessed alien girl's head making a pulse of pink energy that flew through the air into the ceiling over Starfire. "Because whatever can go wrong..." Jinx smiled. The structure above her cracked and splintered into pieces that began coming apart.

"...will" Jinx smirked as the room's integrity failed and started to collapse over the demon. However as chunks of steel and concrete began falling onto Starfire the demon simply swung her arms apart knocking debris away and repelling the rest in a wave of force.

"This girl's power is impressive too, so much strength for such slender arms..." Talarok marveled for a moment before looking back at Jinx "So, you say your name is Jinx then...?" Talarok's voice grew cold and wicked. "Once I've corrupted you girls with demonic energy you will all make very powerful weapons!"

Jinx began to sweat, she couldn't attack the demon directly and Starfire's body was too resilient to damage with anything she could throw at her. Jinx's eyes darted around the room for anything she could use against this thing. As Jinx looked the demon began to whisper something too low to make out. However Jinx realized while she couldn't hear the words she was still able to understand the strange babbling as it seemed to be forced into the back of her head.

Jinx's head felt heavy as the demon started casting some sort of binding on her. Now that Talarok knew her name he was able to invade her mind and started disarming her by arresting her thoughts. All Jinx could hear now was a hushed voice softly begging her "Jinx, relax, just calm yourself Jinx. Won't you lay down your head and rest now Jinx. You can drop your arms to your sides and stop fighting. That's a good girl Jinx, it's time to rest"

Jinx felt herself growing sleepy, she tried to keep her balance but her knees grew weak. At her feet the pink energy flickered and ebbed away as Jinx's focus waned. Jinx knew her mind was slowly falling to Talarok's influence and even though she wanted to fight it the gentle nature of this voice she heard in her head was so irresistible she couldn't say no. Unable to fight it Jinx took one last shot in desperation at the only weakness she could think of.

Jinx's foot momentarily stamped on the floor and she regained her balance just long enough to take aim and throw up one more bolt of energy. Talarok saw the pink mass race under the mist and swung down prepared to block it. But the pink glow below the mist zipped past her and instead came up like a spike right into the relay stone still laying on the table.

"You little whore!" Talarok yelled in anger as the stone shattered and a pulse of energy washed over the room. Starfire stumbled backward clutching her head. "No no no I almost have control! Just a few more moments! I can keep control over this vessel just a few more mome- AAAAGH!"

Starfire was kicked like a mule by a pink blast and landed hard on the floor. Jinx was breathing hard trying to regain her strength but still standing. The mist began to disperse into the corners of the room. The middle of the room the carpet began to return to normal the portal vanishing and revealing Raven as if she was spit out by the floor.

"Damnit Raven do you see what messing with demons gets you?!" Jinx exploded when she saw Raven's body reappear. Raven weakly propped herself up with her arm and tried to find her emotional center still visablely rattled by her close call with the portal to the demon realm.

"Is starfire alright?" Raven managed to meekly ask once her jitters has subsided enough. Raven's apprehension all but melted away when she heard Starfire's real voice once more.

"Yes Starfire is alright" Starfire said before her voice dropped low again "....Raven" Talarok's voice once more reemerged from her lips. Raven's body felt numb as she heard Talarok say her name.

"My my.... Raven, why I do believe that was the name Trigon had for his imppish little spawn... the one that managed to over power him" Talarok laughed as Starfire's body sat up from the floor "A child with the power to alter the fate of the world around her with her power, Another with the strength of a hundred mortals at only 16 and both of them brought to me by you Pandora, or should I say Raven, the daughter of Trigon who's raw untamed power rivals his own..." Talarok roared with laughter now "It's almost too good to believe"

"SHUT UP!" Jinx screamed and flung another bolt of pink energy right at Starfire's head. Raven screamed in protest but the blast hit Starfire and caused her body to flip over once more as Talarok yelled in pain.

Talarok began cursing in a demonic tongue growing angry and fierce. The sound of the unearthly obscenities was so foul Jinx and Raven had to cover their ears in pain and the paint on the walls began to peel. But slowly the voice faded away until it was Starfire's own voice again struggling to form the complex syllables of the demonic speech. Starfire grunted as she tried to surpress Talarok's control.

Raven looked up once she realized the painful utterances had ceased and saw Starfire no longer being manipulated. Quickly Raven rushed over to Starfire and put her hand on Starfire's forehead. "Al'sha-cor ze'ta!" Raven gasped in a rush and a golden light seemed to envelop Starfire's head. As the light subsided Starfire's bright green eyes blinked in surprise. A tense few minutes passed as none of the girls uttered a word but only looked on in suspense.

"He is gone friends" Starfire finally spoke when she was sure she felt no lingering control.
12112111.title: The Demon Jinxed

choices: "You can get some rest as I reserch this a little more"
"We can go out for a bite to eat an relax a bit"
121121111.content:
Several hours and many many apologies later Raven and Starfire sat silently at the table in the main meeting room of the tower as Starfire uneasily sipped a cup of tea with Raven across the table from her very sheepishly looking down at her own cup. Behind her Jinx leaned against the wall still scowling at Raven.

Raven sighed heavily again and looked up at her friend eyes full of regret "Starfire.... really I never meant for any of this.., I-I'm so-"

"Sorry! Sorry sorry sorry" Jinx mocked " You're just so sorry!" Jinx thrust herself away from the wall with her shoulder and marched over to Raven to look her in the eyes "But you've said it to Starfire about a hundred times and not once to me!" Jinx pushed in closer to Raven so she couldn't look away "I know Starfire is shaken up but I got dragged into this too you know and almost kidnapped by a demon that you summoned!" Jinx growled.

Raven's expression shifted from remorse to pain as she and Jinx locked eyes. Raven tried not to let herself get too emotional but despite her normally impressive composure she couldn't fight back tears beginning to well up. Jinx turned disgusted as Raven tried not to let out a sob.

"Oh god here comes the waterworks!" Jinx threw up her hands "You can cry but you still can't say a damn thing about what a major fuck up that was up there, nothing but sorry sorry sorry to Starfire" Starfire who normally would have come to Raven's defense was still trembling too much to say a word. "Well if that's all you can do I'm leaving!" Jinx sneered and spun around towards the door "Later Pan-dor-ah!"

"No!" Raven managed to call out wiping away the tears "You can't leave" She followed through as her voice cracked and broke still emotional.

"And why not?!" Jinx got indigent looking back to Raven angrily

"Because he knows our names now" Raven's gaze returned to her cup of untouched tea. Raven's voice went lower and she sighed "I need to be sure he can't make contact with us again and use our names to manipulate us.... so please, stay for a few days while I sort this out and repair what's been-"

"No!" Jinx hissed and pointed a finger accusing at Raven "You've done enough already!" Jinx stomped heavily back towards the blue haired girl "If that demon tries anything I'll take him on myself! I don't need any more help from you!"

"But I..." Raven tried to explain

"Shut up!" Jinx scolded "I've had it with you and your damn emo bullshit! I'm gone!" She stamped a foot once more and started to leave again

"Please" Starfire suddenly spoke up causing Raven and Jinx to look at her in surprise "Please just stay..." Starfire continued her voice was soft not able to speak without a uneasy tone about it "Let Raven take care of the demon's threat that looms over our heads"

"Starfire..." Raven looked to her friend with a redeemed enthusiasm "Thank you" Raven smiled knowing Starfire still trusted her

"Tsk.... fine" Jinx spat "But only because you're asking me to!" Jinx reluctantly agreed.

Raven thought for a while longer in silence before speaking to her firends again "If you two would like...."
121121111.title: Threat Looming

choices: The group returns to the tower, and Raven immediately begins research on Talarok
The group returns to the tower, but Raven procrastinates for a week...
1211211112.content:
... We can go out for a bite to eat and relax a bit. How does pizza sound?"

"Sounds absolutely glorious, friend Raven!" Starfire immediately broke the last lingering vibes from her posession at the mention of the Titans' dietary staple, floating over to Raven and giving her a rib-crushingly strong hug.

"That... actually isn't a bad idea," Jinx sort of half-mumbled after giving it some thought. "Cleaning up that mess you made really took a lot out of me, I'm starving!"

"Then it is decided!" Starfire cheered as her grip on Raven loosened enough for the hooded spellcaster to slide down onto the ground. "We three shall depart immediately to consume the pizza and drink the sweet carbonated beverages!"

With the decision now unanimous, Starfire made a bee-line for the nearest window and proceeded to divebomb towards sealevel.

"WAIT!" Jinx yelled out after the alien girl as Raven finally managed to pick herself up off the ground.

There was a slight pause, then Starfire's head reappeared just beyond the windowsill.

"Yes, friend Jinx?"

"I can't fly." the pink-haired hexxer admitted, unable to hide the hint jelousy in her voice.

"Do not worry! For I shall help you to fly!" The alien girl said with a reassuring smile as she reentered the meeting room.

"Starfire," Raven said as she cracked her spine back into place. " I don't think that's what she-"

"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAaaaaaahhhhh!"

Raven watched as Starfire grabbed Jinx by the hand and yanked her back out the window with her. An anime style sweatdrop appeared on the back of her hood as she quickly uttered the incantation she used to levitate.

"Just when we had gotten her to stick around..."

------------------------------

Jinx wringed her hair out for the umpteenth time as a waitress came by to take everyone's orders; dislodging a crab and a snail or two in the proccess. About halfway between the tower and the Jump City coastline, the hexxer's repeated pleas of "letmegoletmegoletmego!" had managed to overcome the sound of the tunnel of air Starfire made whenever she flew at her full speed. Starfire, of course, responeded to her friend's request immediately- by dropping her in the middle of the pacific ocean. Only thanks to Raven's timely arrival and quick explination was the orange-skinned girl able to see the error of her actions and prevent Jinx from comically getting eaten by a giant squid.

"I would once again like to appologize, friend Jinx. If you had told me that you wished to be returned to dry land, I would have done so imme-"

"Just shut up," Jinx snarled across the round table to where Raven and Starfire were sitting, before noticing and quickly punt-kicking the crab that had gotten tangled in her hair off the resturaunt's balcony sitting area. "If it weren't for the fact that my head might start making 360 degree turns any minute now, I would be out doing something more productive than hanging out with you two."

"Well, for what it's worth, thanks for sticking around long enough for me to insure that nothing else will happen." Raven added in, allowing a feeling of sincerity to be conveyed in her voice to make it clear to Jinx that she really appreciated this.

Jinx responded with a snort and an indignant raising of her head. After another quick patdown of her hair to insure that all marine wildlife had been removed, the waitress returned with the trio's order: a medium sized pizza that was one-third mushroom and olive, one third pepperoni, and one third chocolate and marshmellow by the request of Starfire. After the drinks had been placed and Raven slipped the waitress a twenty dollar bill to pay for everything, the three each broke off a slice of pizza from their perferred third.

Time passed by quickly, almost in a blur as Starfire, Raven, and eventually Jinx after she had cooled off some, began to discuss everything from what movies were coming out this month to the recent rumors that some of the members of the Brotherhood of Evil had escaped from the crippling defeat the Titans had handed them a few months ago and were once again at large around the world.

"But Raven," Starfire managed to say with perfect clarity through bites of chocolate, cheese, and pizza sauce; a talent she had come to master whilst staying here on Earth. "Did we not soundly vanquish the forces of evil during our last encounter and imprison them in the solid water?"

"We did," the blue-haired spellcaster replied. "But when has that ever stopped anyone? The bad guys always find a way to escape and continue doing what they always do, and they won't stop unless we-"

"Kill them?" Jinx added in with a smug grin on her face.

"I wasn't going to say that." Raven's face darkend as she took another sip from her soda.

"Uh huh, sure. First you start summoning demons, and now your thinking about flat out dropping your enemies dead. You didn't switch sides behind our backs did you?"

It took a fair bit of concentration on Raven's part to resist Jinx's baiting. It would only make the situation worse if she got angry and told her off. If she reacted and drove the pink-haired hexxer away, then there would be no way to insure that she wouldn't get posessed. No, she needed her here for now.

"Not answering is the same as admitting!" Jinx said in an almost singsong tone as she reached into the pizza box for another slice...

"Is this thing really empty?"

Upon hearing those words, Starfire reached out and inspected the box herself, flipped the box over, and proceeded to eat it, before coming to the same conclusion.

"Friend Jinx is right! the pizza has been devoured, and yet I still feel the rumbles within my stomach..."

"That's odd..." Raven said as she realized that she also felt like she could use another slice or two. "Normally we don't even get through one of these unless Cyborg or Beast Boy are here..."

"Well, don't look at me!" Jinx said as she slurped the last bit of her cola. "Maybe the owners made the pizza smaller since the place is losing money."

"Then it is decided! I shall order us a second pizza and another round of fizzy drinks!"

"Starfire, we haven't agreed on-"

The rest of Raven's words were drowned out by the sound of Starfire taking off and flying back towards the counter where orders are placed.

"Whatever, a second round is fine with me. Whatever we don't eat we can just take back to your place for dinner." Jinx said as she flicked a snail that had been crawling up her leg off and onto the pavement below.

-----------------------

"Ahhhh..." Starfire sighed contently as she leaned back in her chair and gently patted her slightly distended belly. "At long last the rumblings have subsided!"

"Finally..." Jinx jeered as she emptied her second glass of soda.

"Ok, now that everyone's done, let's head back to the tower. Starfire, can you carry the rest of the pizza back with you?" Raven said as she dusted crumbs off her robes.

"Understood!" Starfire enthusiastically answered before returning her atention to the box- which she proceeded to look inside of, flip upside down, and subsequently eat.

"It was gone..." Starfire said through bites of greasy cardboard.

"You guys ate two whole pizzas?" Jinx sighed. Not even the goons she used to hang out with back in the H.I.V.E FIVE ate that much.

Ignoring the fact that Jinx forgot to mention that she must have eaten as much as everyone else, Raven merely got up from her seat and turned to face everyone.

"It doesn't matter, let's just head back."
1211211112.title: taking a break...

12112111121.content:
It took a little coordination to work out the flying arrangements for Jinx before they left. The first few attempts gave both girls tummy aches as they didn't enjoy being held or carried in a way that put pressure on their now stuffed stomachs. The first way they tried to fly had Jinx with her arms wrapped around Starfire's exposed midsection so tight she squeezed out a burp. Now as they glided back to the tower Jinx was riding on Starfire like a horse with her hands gripping her shoulders to balance herself and her rear seated at about the bottom of Starfire's back.

Starfire had promised to take it easy not flying too fast or erratic but after a few minutes just as the tower was coming into view Starfire began swooping left and right scanning the city around them.

"For crying out loud Starfire!" Jinx gasped as she clung to the alien girl for dear life when her flying humanoid steed took a sharp curve as she banked left down the main drag of the coastline. "if you keep this up I'm either going to fall off or hurl!" Jinx threatened, Starfire didn't respond much aside from a muffled apology and kept darting this way and that looking at the shops. "What are you trying to find exactly? -urp-" Jinx demanded as a small burp of air was released from her shaken up gut packed with food.

"I know I observed it here once before..." Starfire pondered and slowed down much to Jinx's relief "Ah-ha!" Starfire exclaimed and suddenly dive bombed to the ground with Jinx screaming in terror latched to her back.

On the ground Raven caught up to them to find Jinx sitting on the ground panting while Starfire admired the selection of an ice cream stand on the boardwalk. "You nut job what were you -hic- thinking?!" Jinx spat "Oh great -hic- now I have the hiccups -hic-"

Starfire broke away from her hungry stare of frozen sweets to look back to Jinx "I am sorry Jinx, I was most preoccupied with trying to remember where I had seen this shop before" Starfire pouted "I will treat you to anything you like however, the ice cream shall be above me!"

"You mean, on you Starfire" Raven sighed "And how can you want ice cream? We just had two thirds of a pizza each"

"Well I do have nine stomachs" said Starfire still looking over the ice cream case "Perhaps I am exceptionally voracious today?"

Raven put a hand to her head, Starfire may have nine stomachs but she still had the same abdominal space as the rest of them. "Well if it's -hic- on you then I'm getting something to fix these Hic-hic-cups" Jinx decided and marched to the counter to buy a soda. While jinx tried to guzzle as much of the soda as she could in one swig Starfire began requesting flavor samples of each of the 68 varieties available.

"-hic- Darn it!" Jinx grumbled as another hiccup popped out when she expected a burp. She began to pour more soda down her throat.

"I expect this behavior from Starfire but I'm surprised you still have room for that carbonated gas too" Raven raised an eyebrow at Jinx.

"Beats me, I was stuffed a minute ago but I still have room for this" Jinx said between gulps. She began bouncing up and down on her feet while trying to suck down the last of her soda to produce a burp strong enough to beat her hiccups.

"-Braaaaaaaaaaaap-" A loud and uncouth burp suddenly erupted from Raven instead of Jinx. Both girls exchanged surprised glances while Starfire kept requesting samples without noticing.

Jinx began to giggle at Raven who turned red and covered her mouth. "Hey now that was supposed to be my... -Uuuuuuuuuuuuap-" Jinx suddenly let loose her own belch. Raven's complexion returned to it's normal grey and she snickered at Jinx who was somewhat stunned by the outburst.

"Well I guess I'm not the only one with no manners" Raven grinned and started walking over to the counter with Starfire.

"Say what you want" Jinx proudly smiled in triumph "At least my hiccups are gone" She joined Raven by the counter

"You know it's weird but I could really go for some ice cream now too..." Raven licked her lips and looked over the flavors in the chilled glass before her.

"Yeah..." Jinx mused walking along the case "I was just going to get the soda but now I could go for a treat myself" She said absent mindlessly rubbing her now no longer stuffed belly.

"Go right ahead friends!" Starfire smiled as she stuck a small wooden dipper in her mouth to taste another flavor "As I stated before the bill will be mine!"

Raven and Jinx suddenly found themselves needing no further motivation. While neither girl often went for the richer flavors Raven was finding the peanut butter and chocolate chip ice cream tantalizing enough to order a large bowl full sprinkled with cookie and cake crumbs. Meanwhile Jinx had her gaze glued to the tub of fudge and cookie dough which she had piled into a bowl of her own with chocolate syrup poured onto it. While they both found new interest in heavier sweets Starfire had finally made up her mind. After a bit of insistence on her part she convinced a few of the clerks behind the counter to assemble a cone consisting of a scoop of each flavor like a rainbow colored tower.

Walking along the beach in the night back towards the closest point the coat line made to their tower the girls said little to one another until their ice cream was all gone. They had remained mostly quiet aside from the sound of slurping or satisfied yums occasionally escaping their lips. They were just so infatuated with their new treats they had barely focused on much else. And even as they neared the end of their indulgences their idle chit chat somehow diverted away from just how much they had consumed that night.

Reaching the end of the pier that faced their tower the girls tossed their wrappers and plastic utensils into the nearest trash can and prepared to fly with Starfire leaning down on all fours so Jinx could saddle up. Though they were stuffed and their bellies now poked out visibly fuller than what they were typically, the girls kept laughing and chatting bissfully unaware of just how much they had binged.



Back at the tower there was some disagreement that broke the friendly air of conversation they had enjoyed on the beach. Raven wanted to sequester herself to her room and focus on her books in solitude until she found something of interest on this demon they could use. Jinx refused to let Raven keep them cooped up in the tower unless she was allowed to see what Raven was studying and even do some digging herself. Then Starfire's interjection that if a threat was presented to all of them then they must remain together at all times sealed it.

Raven moved a large collection of her books into the main commons of the Tower and made a nice fort out of them by the table, she could study in and be surrounded by her texts. Jinx padded around the books for a while sizing them up like she could intimidate them into revealing the answers until an annoyed stare from Raven forced her to simply pick a book to look in and joined Starfire on the couch. Starfire tried to remain upbeat for her friends sake but quickly grew bored just watching them read and turned to the TV to watch for a while.

It wasn't long however until their dinner caught up to them. Starfire and Jinx grew tired, bellies full of pizza and ice cream, nodded off leaned against each other's shoulder. Raven surrounded by her books also found the words beginning to blur as her eyes kept relaxing and going crossways trying to fight off the drowsy feeling creeping over her. Soon Raven was laying on a book like a pillow with a small trickle of drool soaking into the pages.
12112111121.title: Tempting Treats

choices: The enemies prove to be no match for our heroes, and they proceed to Cafe Street
The enemies are too strong, and the team gets seperated in the conflict
121121111211.content:
A burst of excited laughter ecoed around black pillars and gold-encrusted hallways. A figure cloaked in an all-concealing red robe gazed into a black orb from behind a black and gold mask, laughing with immesurable glee at the scene projected before his eyes.

"Hahahahaha! Oh this is priceless!" The demon announced as he looked upon the lulled and content faces of his soon-to-be champions. "They're so worried about being corrupted, but have no idea that the proccess has already begun!"

Laughter continued to spread throughout Talarok's lair as he began thinking about his immensely good fortune.

"And to think that I almost spent the entire day sleeping! I was worried I blew my chance at winning those girls to my side when the possession had failed, but this has worked out much better than I thought it would! A slow, gradual corruption is a solid corruption!"

The temperature in the room continued to increase with the demon's improving mood, to the point that candles flaoting around the room were redued to pools in moments and steam seemed to rise up from the ground.

Talarok's laughter suddenly stopped dead as a thought crossed his mind.

"hmm, but prehaps this pace is a bit too gradual," he mused to himself. "The old fools that dominate our little parlor games aren't going to just sit around and wait for me to groom three new champions with immesurable potential, I'm going to need my seasonal draft pick sooner rather than later if I'm going to take them by surprise and expand my influence."

Talarok placed his scrying crystal into a nearby stand and snapped his fingers.

"Oh, Succulance," The demon called out in a rather smooth voice.

Almost instantly, a pool of what appeared to be cake frosting had formed on the ground; and out of it stepped a plump, pale-skinned woman with blond hair and red eyes who was dressed in an extremely tight-fitting white chefs outfit.

"Ah, Master! It has been so long since you've personally summoned me to your quarters. Shall I prepare for you an irresistable treat? Or-"

The woman's strained outfit seemed to melt off her like icecream, revealing a transparent nightgown that showed off her generous muffintop and lovehandles.

"-were you hoping for something more personal?"

Beneath his gilded mask, a wide smile spread across the demon's face. "hmm, prehaps later. Now Succulance, in the past few weeks, I've been in contact with an exceptionally powerful mortal by the name of Raven. It took some going back and forth but a few hours ago I managed to posess one of her friends - I lost that posession, but I managed to plant the tinniest seed of corruption into their minds before I was sent back. Those seeds have taken root now, but I'll need you to travel to the mortal relm and speed things up a little. Have I made myself clear?"

"Yes sir!" The minion cheered as her clothes began to reform around her chubby body.

"Excellent," Talarok waved his left hand in the air, and three pieces of paper suddenly appeared in the middle of his palm. "Here are some pictures of what Raven and her friends look like, along with some personal information I found while digging around in their heads."

The demon handed off the papers to his subordinate, before pausing in thought for a moment "You know what? I'm going to give you some help on this one."

Talarok reached into his robe and pulled out a stringed collection of bits and pieces and selected a black cross. He viewed the object with a vague sense of disgust for a moment, before casually tossing it to the ground a few feet awat from him. As the holy symbol struck the ground, a ghostly image of a medieval templar suddenly took form in the room.

"My liege," The figure said as it took a knee.

"Sir Zelik, you are to accompany this fair lady here and protect her. Under no circumstances is she to be harmed, understand?"

"Your will be done," The armored spirit nodded.

"Wonderful!" The demon said with glee as he began twirling his hands and muttering dark incantations. "Now, both of you hold still."

------------------------------------------------------

The door to the Titans' common room was suddenly thrown open.

"Jeez, so that's where you guys are. I've been looking everywhere for you!" Beast Boy said inbetween gasps of air.

The sudden noise managed to stir the three heroines from their deep slumber. Slowly, Raven groggily lifted her head off her makeshift pillow and turned to face the green shapeshifter.

"Ugh, Beast Boy. What's going on?"

"Bad stuff, what else! Come on, we've got to head downto-"

Beast Boy lost his train of thought as he noticed an extra person in the group of two he had been sent to go track down.

"Um, hey, why is Jinx here?" The shapeshifter inquired as a black question mark hung above his head.

"It's a long story, just know that I'm coming with for whatever's going on right now," The pink-haired hexxer mumbled as she removed herself from Starfire's shoulder.

"Uh... okay sure. Glad to have you with us," Beast Boy rubbed the back of his head nervously. "Now come on guys, Robin is waiting for us outside!"

----------------------------------------------------

"Alright, reports are coming in about a disturbance on Cafe Street," Robin announced to the team as the Titans made their way through groups of panicked civillians who were all fleeing away from the very same situation that they were rushing head first into.

"Any idea who the trouble maker is?" Cyborg aked.

"Dudes, my bet's on Control Freak. He used to crash the movie rental place on Cafe Street all the time." Beast Boy shot a few glances around at the others. "Anyone else for betting on who the villian is this time?"

As a response, he got a few glares from Raven and Jinx.

"Whoever this villian is, he or she will soon taste defeat!" Starfire said with conviction as the sun above her was suddenly blocked by something.

All of a sudden, a flurry of black arrows descended from the sky. Raven quickly threw up a shield to cover them, while nearby cars, trashcans, and atm machines were pierced by the incoming rounds.

Raven lowered the shield once she was sure that the rain of arrows had stopped. "I believe we we must be getting close now"

Starfire floated over to a nearby arrow. She pulled it out of the ground and sniffed it, before biting it in half.

"It is the dark chocolate!" Starfire stated triumphantly as she proceeded to eat the rest of the arrow.

"you have got to be kidding me, that's just dumb" Jinx smacked her face with her palm. "What kind of lame villian uses dark chocolate as a wea-"

Another black arrow passed right next to her ear, causing the hexxer to lock up for a moment; before turning to see the dozen or so figures clad in medieval armor that seemed to be made of the same material as the arrow.

"Titans, go!" Robin yelled as he and the rest of the heroes made a charge towards the line of black-colored suits of armor.

121121111212.content:
As the three stuffed heroines snoozed, a nearby smouldering stick of incense that Raven had lit in a desperate attempt to stay focused over the blaring tv suddenly blazed with unearthly vigor.

"A'rel. Azomoth. Deros. Ti'kal. Minoth. Go'el. Azomoth. Tikal. Minoth. Sarbles!" a voice far to low for the sleeping girls to understand flowed out of the stick as a puff of smoke, which slowly began to whisp its way towards Raven, Starfire, and Jinx, and proceeded to allow itself to be inhaled by each of the girls.

"Friend Raven, Where exactly are we?"

"I'm... not quite sure, Starfire."

"Wherever we are, this place has some style."

The trio stood on a paved path leading up to an enormous palace made entirely of marble embroidered with gold that stood several stories tall, which sat on top of a hill and was guarded by an endless patrol of classical age Grecco-Roman statues that were lined up along each side of the road. Surrounding the statues and the road was an endless field of pristine grass that achived a shape and color one could only expect in a work of fiction. Above it all hung a perfectly clear blue sky and a sun positoned so nicely as to warm everything comfortably without blinding anyone looking in any particular direction.

"It's impressive, to say the least." Raven nodded in agreement.

"... Raven? Is this the heaven that the old man in the infomercials described? Have we been vanquished by our foes whilst we slept and transported to your afterlife?" Starfire said nervously whispered to Raven as she looked at each of the surrounding statues.

"I wouldn't jump to any conclusions just yet," The blue-haired spellcaster said as she moved forward to examine the closest statue further.

"If this isn't heaven, it aught to be! Just feel this grass! It's so soft and smooth. Makes me want to take a nap on it!" Jinx said as she took a seat on a nearby patch of green and proceeded to recline on it.

"Stop!" Raven suddenly blurted out as she rushed forward and yanked Jinx back onto the pavement by her wrist.

"Ow! The hell was that for, Raven?" The pink-haired hexxer growled.

"We don't know anything about this place. For all we know, this could be one of Talarok's tricks. Don't. Touch. Anything." Raven retorted with the most serious look she felt safe enough to convey.

"Yeah... yeah, your right. We should be careful." Jinx nodded in agreement as Raven helped her to her feet.

"If this world is a creation of our foe, then how would we go about returning home?" Starfire asked as she huddled in close to Raven and completely violated the spellcaster's need for personal space.

"... Well, it looks like there's only one way to go, so let's start by heading to the top of that hill," Raven answered as she lead the way towards the majestic citadel waiting for them a few hundred feet away. As they approached, the trio saw that there was no formal doorway, only two lines of columns that supported that section of the roof in which a passerby could enter through any gap between the intricately carved pillars.

"Wish I lived here..." Jinx commented as she beheld the arcitectural marvel up close, though a quick glare from Raven was enough to remind her of the potential severity of the situation.

With no other obvious entry point, the three heroines stepped passed the towering white stones and entered a sort of foyer that served as the hub for several branching off hallways and staircases. Other than that, there didn't seem to be anything of interest in their current location other than a sitting area in the center of the room that had two gold embroidered red sofas poistioned around a table that had three trays of tea and cookies resting on it.

"How long have those been there?" Jinx pointed to the snack platters. "I can see steam rising from that tea kettle in the middle."

"Perhaps the owner of this very large and intricately decorated home is expecting guests?"

"Yeah, us. There's three platters, so whoever set this up expected us to stop by here. Just leave them there and help me figure out the quickest way to this place's back door." Raven said as she moved in closer to inspect the nearest staircase for any obvious traps.

"Oh, come on. Who booby traps tea and cookies? I'm starving over here! Feels like I haven't eatten anything in a week."

"I too am feeling a strong case of the rumbles within my stomach. Perhaps if we took a short break and took advantage of our host's hospitality, we would be in a better position to discover a way back home."

Raven suddenly felt of jolt of pain in her midsection. Suddenly, she too felt like she hadn't had anything to eat in awhile. She had been meaning to make some tea when they returned to the tower from dinner, and those cookies did look rather good right now...

That's when the smell finally hit her. It was her favorite brand of jasmine tea. Somehow, whoever set this up had known what her favorite drink was. Which could only mean-

"AAAGH!" Raven momentarily lost her cool and blasted an enormous shockwave towards the offending snack trays, sending the tea, cookies, table, and sofas flying outside of the building.

"Friend Raven, what is the matter? Why have you attacked the furniture?" Starfire turned to face the exasperated Raven with a concerned look on her face.

"I... I'm sorry.It's just... the smell reminded me of my favorite brand of tea... the only way anyone could have known what my favorite drink smelled like-"

"Was if he had gotten inside your head," Jinx finished Raven's sentence, though this time it wasn't as an insult.

"Exactly..." Raven said as she let out a deep breath and tried to regain control of her emotions, before deciding to take a seat on the stone floor below and enter her mediation pose.

"Alright, look. I'm going to need a minute to regain my focus. Can I trust you two to do a little scouting up ahead? I don't think we should stay here for longer than is neccessary."

"Of course, Raven! I shall go on ahead and insure that there are no more troublesome tea sets that might prove be offensive to you!"

"What Star said. We can handle it," Jinx added in as the two headed off towards different pathways that branched off from the entrence.

"If you guys see anything important looking, come back here immediately and let me know." Raven called out as she saw the other two disappear down their respective cooridoors.

Raven let out another deep breath and began uttering a litnay of concentration or two as she began diffusing her stress level.

"Just don't touch anything guys..." Raven whispered to herself. "... and please comeback safe."

1312.content:
Ty Lee hopped easily from fencepost to fencepost as she made her way down the quiet city street.

Hup. Hup. Hup.

And with every hop, she felt it bounce.

Blff. Blff. Blff.

The festivities celebrating the end of hostilities had been amazing, and had gone on for nearly two weeks -- two weeks of eating, and dancing, and eating, and fireworks, and eating, and eating, and speeches, and eating, until the little acrobat was sure she would burst from either excitement or dumplings. Well, she hadn't burst. But she'd ended up with a little memento of the time all the same.

Ty Lee had developed a pot belly.

It was cute, everyone had told her. You can hardly tell it's there, and anyway, it's a party, Ty Lee, have another bowl of something fattening. Easy for them to say -- she was the one who was going to be back performing in from of the crowds in less than a week! Which is why she was up at the crack of dawn, doing a ten mile run on an empty stomach.

She nearly missed a post. Ugh, she was out of condition, too.

She came to the end of the row of posts. Hmm... she could hang a right and head towards the palace to visit with Mai, see how life as the Fire Lady was treating her... and maybe have herself a very small breakfast?

Or....

Ty Lee glanced left, towards the Garden, which is what they euphemistically called the facility where poor Azula was shut up. The thought made Ty Lee shudder. Azula had gone mad, in the end, and cruelty had swallowed her... and yet she'd been a friend, once.
1312.title: The Antagonists: Azula, Ty Lee, Mai, June, etc

13122.content:
It wasn't easy getting in to see Azula. First Ty Lee had to wait while several of the higher-ups were called to confirm her identity, then she was ushered into a small, secure room to wait some more while the former princess was brought out under guard. When Ty Lee finally saw her old friend, she wanted to cry.

The wretched, half-starved thing in front of her couldn't be the right person. Surely, even in chains, she would hold herself with the same dignity, the same bold, larger-than-life, egotistical majesty that Azula had always had. This girl was just ... empty. Defeated. Pathetic.

And then she raised her head, and Ty Lee recognized the rage and white-hot anger in her eyes. "You!" she snarled, straining at her restraints. "Filthy traitorous slattern! "

"Azula, I--"

Azula seemed to calm down. Her wild eyes faded, taking on a duller cast, and she laughed, two short, sharp barks.

"My, my, Ty Lee. Treachery agrees with you, it seems. You've gotten fat. Been gorging yourself at the royal trough?"

Reflexively, Ty Lee sucked in her belly, and Azula sneered.

"It's no use, you know, visiting me here. Lie all you want; I know who's the rightful Firelord and who's a sniveling usurper." She smiled. "Enjoy being Zuzu's lapdog while you can. I know about the resistance. I know my loyal subjects are even now fighting for the honor of the Fire Nation and their rightful ruler."

Oh, Azula, Ty Lee thought sadly. There was no resistance worth talking about. Most of her people already referred to her openly as 'Azula the Mad', or with other, cruder epithets.

"Azula," she said again, "please. We were friends once. I hope we can be friends again, some day."

"Unchain my hands, you slimy, ungrateful sow, and I'll show you just how friendly I feel towards you right now."

"I can't do that, Azula -- you're -- you're not well, and--"

"Lies," Azula moaned, "lies, lies, lies, lies!"

"--and please, please, Azula, won't you eat something? They said you haven't eaten since you arrived."

"I swore I would not eat until my rightful position was restored. I have faith in my people. It will not be long. Besides, the swill they serve is this rathole isn't fit for a pig." Azula smirked. "Perhaps they'll let you guzzle down a bucket or two on your way out, my dear little porker."

Ty Lee sniffed. "Maybe ... maybe you're right. But it might be longer than you think, if you'd only eat a little--"

"Never!' Azula spat. "I would rather starve and die as Firelord than live on Zuzu's scraps."

Ty Lee straightened her back. "Azula, if you'll only eat, then while I'm here, you can be my Firelord."

"Hmm?"

"I'll get you real food. From the palace. Food be-befitting your station. And I will do anything for you."

"Anything?" Azula asked. "Perhaps we could work something out, if you'll agree to..."
13122.title: How's Azula holding up in captivity?

choices: It's her circus debut ... and Ty Lee is fatter than ever!
Azula spends the next few days glutting herself into a contented stupor.
131221.content:
Lounging in a pillowy heaven, Azula stifled a belch. It simply would not do for the rightful Firelord to be heard brapping out gas like some common peasant or barnyard animal.

Ty Lee had been so deliciously servile all day, kowtowing to her, meeting her every need, and -- more glorious of all -- feeding her. Azula hadn't wanted to admit just how hungry she had been. When that first plate of glorious sticky steamed buns was set before her, it had taken all her willpower not to start stuffing them in her mouth like a ravenous platypus bear. But she had refrained -- she had! She had eaten them daintily. Carefully. With the delicacy befitting her station. And then, she had kept eating.

The little acrobat had set dish after dish in front of her, scarcely saying anything except "yes, Firelord" or "no, Firelord" or showering her with extravagant compliments. Finally! Someone in this stinking hole was treating her the way she deserved. She never, ever wanted this glorious pampering to end. Unfortunately, her stomach had other plans.

Azula belched again into the back of her hand. Burff. She was absolutely gorged.

"You did so well today, Firelord!" Ty Lee chirped, snuggling up against Azula and lightly brushing the girl's distended stomach with a chilled bunch of grapes. Azula felt the cold, moist fruit against her taut skin and shivered. "You'll be your old self again in no time!"

"I'm already feeling like... better..." Azula said sleepily. "You have served me well. Very well."

"Thank you, Firelord."

"I can eat no more. You may finish the rest of this yourself."

Ty Lee grinned. "Thank you, Firelord, but I'm on a diet, remember?"

"The Firelord's leftovers are a great reward. You mean to tell me that you refuse this honor?"

The acrobat's smile grew uncertain. "Azula, I -- I mean, I can't, you know? I'm happy to do this for you, but don't ask me to--"

"You would refuse an order?" Azula's eyes flashed.

"But -- you can't actually order me to--"

"I am your Firelord!" Azula snarled.

Ty Lee sat up ramrod straight. "Yes, Firelord! I'm sorry!" She picked up a half-finished bowl of rice and began scooping it out with her hands and stuffing it in her mouth. Azula smiled. Now this was how she was supposed to be treated.

---------

Ty Lee groaned as she walked slowly away from the Garden, holding a hand to her aching side. Why, oh why had Azula insisted on her finishing every last scrap of those leftovers? She was supposed to be losing weight, and instead she'd been forced to stuff herself to the point of nausea. All her hard work and exercise had been erased, just like that, buried under and avalanche of calories.

Her cheeks burned. She'd never get in shape now. She was going to have to go out, in front of some huge crowd, looking like... like... this! Like a flabby, out-of-shape ball of butter!

But... but Azula had eaten so well. And if this was the cost of keeping that poor girl from starving herself, well, she would just have to bear it.
131221.title: The Firelord's Command

131222.content:
"Azula... I won't humiliate Mai for you." Ty Lee answered gently, hopping that she wouldn't start Azula on one of her violent out bursts.

"I figured as much." Azula spat back, her voice slightly muffled by the muzzle over her mouth. "You say you want to help me and that you will do anything for me, but then when it comes to something as simple as humiliating that traitor, Mai you go back on your word. Just like at the Boiling Rock."

"Thats not it all."

"Thats all it can be!" Screamed Azula as she flew into a rage. "You're not here to help me! You just want to mock me with false promises, only to take them away! Well, it won't work! So go back to your "friends" and tell them that the monster saw through their little game and that they are fools to think that they could fool me!"

"I'm not going to humiliate Mai because of my loyalty to you. I won't play into your delusions of entitlement and injustice. You need to stop thinking that you deserve everything you wanted! Thats not how the world works and only be accepting this are you going to get better!"

"Gerrrraaa!" Yelled Azula as she tried to launch herself at Ty Lee, but was held back by the chains that strapped her to the chair. So instead Azula flew into a tantrum like a wounded beast with a leg caught in a trap. Ty Lee even saw flashes of blue flames beneath her muzzle as she attempted to breath fire, burning her own mouth in the process.

And as she watched Azula cry and moan and scream and rave, Ty Lee was shocked to the point of tears to see how her Azula had gone from a brilliant, logical, and sensible princess to a raving lunatic, broken and locked away. Soon Azula had tired herself out and all she could do was lay her head on the table and sob, and Ty Lee, still upset by her display of madness and pain, walked over and placed Azula's head in her lap as she sat on the table and stroke her princess's face.

"It's Ok Azula. I'm here." Cooed Ty Lee as she tried to comfort the insane Azula. "And I promise not to leave you again."

Her promise not leave was not so much directed at Azula, since Ty Lee doubted that she could hear anything she was saying any more, and more to herself. She knew that it was big commitment and that she would have to post pone her own plans to train with the keoshy warriors and rejoining the circus, but after seeing the pain Azula was in she just couldn't leave friend behind in this place.

So when the guards came to carry Azula back to her cell, Ty Lee demanded that on grounds that she was a lady of high standing and the person friend of both the Fire Lord and the Fire Queen that they let her spend the night by Azula's side even if she had to sleep next to the bars.

1312221.content:
Ty-Lee shifted under the covers, smelling the delicious aroma of frying fish and piping hot soup. It took her a moment to realize where she was, and why the floor under her was so hard. She wasn't at home, but in a high-security prisoner, snoozing on the floor next to Azula's cell.

She sat up, flexing her stiff back. Ugh. Her aura wasn't feeling particularly pink this morning, that was for sure.

She was unpleasantly surprised to see Azula already awake and looking at her -- there are few things more unsettling than realizing that girl's been watching you in your sleep -- but tried her best to look cheerful anyway. "Mornin', Azula."

"So, it wakes," the ex-Fire Lord sneered. "Why are you even still here? I thought I made myself clear. You're unwanted."

One of the guards entered with two trays of food, setting one in front of Ty Lee, and slipping the other through a slot into the cell. Ty Lee nodded at it.

"I asked them to make better food -- I hoped you would have breakfast with me..."

"Why would I do that?" Azula growled. "You didn't do what I asked. After all that garbage about treating me as your Firelord, you weren't even willing to fulfill the simplest request."

Ty Lee gulped. Her voice quivered, but she met Azula's gaze and spoke clearly.

"Azula, I did say you could be my Firelord while I was here. But being Firelord doesn't mean what you seem to think it means. It doesn't mean being some sort of -- of god, or something. You think your brother is spending his time humiliating all his former enemies?"

"Maybe. He certainly did it to me."

"Azula, he spends most of his time in boring meetings about the future of Fire Nation relations with the rest of the world, or reading piles of paperwork, or--"

"How Zuzu chooses to waste his time is no concern of mine," Azula said coldly. "Things will be very different when I regain my throne."

"All I'm saying is... I... I just wanted to eat breakfast with an old friend." Ty Lee sniffled. "Like we used to, remember?"

She picked up the fish and bit into it. It was delicious -- and she could tell the heavenly smell was affecting Azula, whose was starting at her and trying hard not to drool. Even for a woman of her willpower, keeping up this hunger strike had to be taking its toll.

"Oh, fine," Azula spat. "If it'll stop you looking at me with those big eyes of yours. I suppose if I don't have it, you'll stuff both helping down by yourself, and you're fat enough already."

She picked up a handful of rice -- she wasn't allowed to have utensils -- and stuffed it in her mouth. She ate with as much dignity as she could muster, though Ty-Lee could see that her aura was going mad; she was probably having to restrain herself from just cramming the food in her mouth willy-nilly.

"It's good, isn't it?"

"A step up from the usual slop," Azula grudgingly admitted. "I suppose it won't do my subjects any good if I starve myself to death..."

Ty Lee beamed. "That's great, Azula! I'm just glad you ate something, you know?"
1312221.title: Breakfast

13122211.content:
Ty Lee had been with Azula for a week and already the princess was kind of showing some progress. Really all Ty Lee had managed to do was get Azula to start eating again by letting her convince herself that her subjects needed her to be strong. Dr.De Fang, who had taken on Azula's case, wasn't completely happy about letting Azula continue with this fantasy but since it did get her eating again she went along with it for now.

However this was were the good news ended, Azula still fought the orderlies every chance she got, she refused to talk to De Fang during her sessions except to insult her, and during one of her insane fits Ty Lee had to stop her from making herself throw up what she had just eaten. But still getting her to eat was the step in the right direction and De Fang and Ty Lee hoped to build on that.

It was on the seventh day since Ty Lee arrived and Dr. Fang decided to talk about that during her session with Azula that day, she didn't think she would get a response from her patient but she had to try. So there they were in Fang's office, the doctor in her chair and the princess strapped to the couch. The small room was painted whitish yellow and the main source of light came from the two windows despite the iron bars. Da Fang herself was mid thirty year old Earth Kingdom woman with wavy heavy black hair that she kept short so that her patients couldn't grab or pull on it, she had green eyes, and was kind of short with a rather large butt from sitting too much in a chair. But she caired herself with such dignity and grace that no one could logically deny that she wasn't a beautiful woman.

"So Azula, your friend Ty Lee has been with us for a week and I was wondering how you felt about her?" Asked De Fang starting the conversation.

"How about instead of you asking me about my life, I ask you about yours?" Came Azula's reply. "After all, since I'm the one chained up I have the most need to know if my captives are going to kill me or hold me for ransom."

De Fang was shocked by Azula's response, not because she thought they were ether planning to kill her or use her as a hostage, after all it was that kind of thinking they were trying to fix, but that Azula answered with more than a growl and an angry stare or a string of insults. Fang considered asking about this change in behavior but decided not to push her luck.

"So what do you want to know about me?" Asked Fang.

"Everything." Answered Azula. "Like who gave you that Earth Kingdom wedding band on your wrist? And why is someone from the Earth Kingdom even in the Fire Nation?"

"Ok fine. I'm from a town east of Ba Sing Se so we didn't see much of the war. When I was 18 I went to the Ba Sing Se academy for mental health and after I graduated I travelled taking care of the mental wounds caused by the war on both sides. I am now 35 years old and my wife Toph and I..."

"Did you just say my wife Toph?" Azula asked with confusion across her face.

"Yes I did, and not the Toph who travels with the Avatar. A different Toph."

"But you're a woman, right? How can two women marry?"

"Its allowed back in the Earth Kingdom, in fact it use to be allowed in the Fire Nation as well, until your grandfather outlawed it."

"Good for him. Two women falling in love is disgusting."

"Well, you are allowed to have your opinions about the matter same with everyone else. But lets move on. Toph and I moved here after the war because we wanted to settle down and your uncle offered me a job as your doctor."

"HOW DO YOU KNOW THAT TRATOR?!" Screamed Azula in both fear and anger at the mention of her uncle.

"I meet him during his travels after he retired from the Fire Nation army. It was I who helped him get over his son's death. He wanted to make sure that you got someone he could trust to take care of you."

"Iroh doesn't care about me. All his so called love and affection goes to his puppet king Zuko. I think he asked you to infiltrate this hospital so you can kill me and make it look like an accident!" Accused Azula.

"Of course not Azula. Your uncle cares and even loves you. He was just..."

"NO MORE LIES YOU PERVERTED FREAK! YOU PLAN TO KILL ME AND TY LEE SO THAT THE TRAITOR AND THE USURPER CAN RULE UNCHALLENGED!" Azula was now in a full blown tantrum and if it wasn't for the iron chains holding her down De Fang would have terrified, but after seeing the princess pointlessly struggle against these chains dozens of times the affect had worn off. So the doctor simply walked to her door, stuck her head out, and asked for the two orderlies outside the door to come, give Azula a sedative and take her back to her cell, Which the promptly did. De Fang then asked for Ty Lee to come in so they could talk.

131222111.content:
Ty Lee's meeting with Dr. De Fang only lasted a few minuets, with De Fang con-graduating Ty Lee on getting Azula to break her hunger strike and made her promise that if she notices any other changes in Azula's behavior she would tell De Fang strait away. Ty Lee of course agreed to this and then after another few minuets of talking about Azula and each other she went back to the cell she shared with Azula.

"So you returned after talking to that perverted murderer." Azula stated through her muzzle as the guards let Ty Lee pass through the heavy metal door.

"Of course I did, Azula." Ty Lee responded in her normal cheerful manner. "I told you I would never leave you again and so I won't."

"But why would you stay? You already betrayed me once before, so I know that your decision isn't motivated by loyalty or friendship. And with this blasted jacket restricting me, you have no reason to fear me. So why do it? Why stay?"

Ty Lee instantly recognized the signs that Azula was about to go into one of her tantrums caused by her delusions and paranoia, and since she didn't want to see her Princess return to that dark place in her mind Ty Lee acted quickly to comfort her. Taking the strapped up Azula in her arms, she whispered gently in her friend's ear.

"Because you are my best friend and I do care about you. And like I said before, I only saved Mai because you were loosing your mind and I had to stop you before you did something you would later regret."

"LIER!" Azula yelled as she tried to break away from Ty Lee's embrace, but was unable to do to the straight jacket and her friend's tight grip, so she continued to scream at her. "It's your fault I'm in here! This is all your fault!"

"How is this my fault Azula?" Ty Lee asked, both astonished and insulted that the princess would accuse her of this. "I didn't make you banish all of your servants, nor did I make you have a mental break down when Katara and Zuko defeated you, and I'm definitely not causing you to have tantrums or create false memories or have delusions. So tell me, how is it my fault that you are trapped here?"

"I hate you Ty Lee." Azula growled, her unstable mind completely blocking Ty Lee's question when it couldn't come up with an answer. "I hate, hate, hate, hate, love you Ty Lee!"

Azula then retreated back into silence, but Ty Lee could only stare at her friend, dumb struck by what she had said.

"She couldn't have meant it." Ty Lee thought to herself after the initial shock wore off and the worry began to set in. "I'm mean she sounded so angry that it had to be a slip of the tong. There's no way Azula could have meant it when she said she loved me. She's insane. But... on the other Dr. Fang did ask me to report any strange behavior and it doesn't get any stranger than that. But do I have the right to impose on Azula's privacy when it could have been a slip of the tong. Maybe I should wait until I know that it was more than an accident. Yet what if by doing that I'm cause Azula even more misery? I can't take that chance, I have to tell Dr. Fang first thing tomorrow morning, right after breakfast."
