131321111111111111111.content:
As she hefted herself into a sitting position inside her Inn's room, Katara remembered stumbling back to her hotel room in the dark, too exhausted to search out Toph and Suki after finally tracking down Ty Lee. She had no real way of keeping Ty Lee put, but she hoped that the stern talking-to she gave her after received after they had eaten through the entire stock of the bakery...

"Who am I kidding. She's probably bigger than I am by now." Katara frustratedly murmured to herself. Putting her index fingers to her temples, Katara tried to silence her hunger pangs long enough to to make a guess at how long she had slept. She certainly felt refreshed. She noticed she had never changed out of her old clothes, which were discolored with frosting and the buckets of sweat they had absorbed since their journey began.Her sheets were as damp and frosting-blotched as her clothes. Katara guessed was so exhausted she probably just fell face-first into her bed. Katara noted her morning breath was probably the most pungent it had ever been in her life, which must mean she had probably slept for a prolonged period of time. The whole room was almost humid from the smell of her unwashed body. It was daylight, but only just; it seemed to be the crack of dawn. It all clicked at once.

I've been asleep for like thirty hours!! Katara gasped, granting herself another unpleasant whiff of her breath. She was frightened for Ty Lee and Suki, but even more frightened for what her appetite would be like once her stomach woke up...Katara decided if she was even going to function, she'd need to gather as much butter as possible and get to the beach so she could fish up some elephant koi. She would -try- and cook it all but chances are she wouldn't have the time, as she could already feel a void deep within her stomach and an itch growingstarting in the back of her mind. She would have to eat whatever she came across from the vendors along the way to work up some semblance of bending power, then cram as much seafood down her gullet as possible before the real withdrawals started to kick in. As she threw herself to her feet, hearing a small tearing noise from one leg of her stretch pants, Katara had cleared from her mind of all other priorities. Already sweating from anxiety, Katara stumbled out of her room without any further thoughts towards her friends, a cure, or taking care of that terrible morning breath.

----

"Toph, I'm not kidding! I need to hand out watch assignments!" Suki was contentedly slurping down a plate of fried eggs heaped on top of a buttered roll, the first course of her breakfast. Despite her heavy binging over the last day, her soldierly discipline managed to keep her internal clock razor-sharp. If Toph hadn't heard her trying to get her chest plate back on, Suki would have strolled right out of her house, back to exercise and drills!

They decided to crash at Suki's place for the night, and Toph had outright declined Suki's offer to draw her a bath. Not wanting to make her too uncomfortable (or expose anyone less tolerant than Katara to a full night of her flatulence), Toph slept on the floor of the main room of the one-story village house. After getting woken up by Suki, Toph had managed to gather enough breakfast to keep her from bolting back to the Kiyoshi warriors. Toph had managed to keep Suki supplied with enough food to keep her from scrutinizing her increasingly dubious excuses for a whole day, but she had almost slipped through Toph's puffy fingers this morning. Lucky, they stumbled across Ty Lee last afternoon, eating her way through a wedding cake she had purchased. A complete sugar-addict, Toph had little trouble getting Ty Lee to keep Suki distracted with her. The last thing Ty Lee wanted was a tongue-lashing from Suki when she was back on the job, and the longer she could postpone that, the better.

...Which brought Toph to her current situation. Ty Lee gave a knock at Suki's front door and entered without waiting for a response. Suki looked up. The acrobat had a bag in one hand, which she promptly reached into to retrieve a sweet roll. "Ok, the second in command is in charge again for the day! I went and told 'em!" Suki's glare was no less intimidating without her makeup, even with bedhead. "I told you not to do that! I said I was going to get up on time, and I did! See!" Toph cut in before Suki let her anger stifle her appetite. "We'll work it out after breakfast." Toph tried to visualize Ty Lee's extra weight. She didn't seem any more lethargic than she did two days ago, but she definitely was far less of a waif, her vibrations proved it. To Suki, Ty Lee's body seemed to have been stretched horizontally at first glance. There were no visible rolls, but her stomach was wider and rounded out, making her acrobat's clothes look more like a belly-dancer's. Her bloated chest further suggested the archetype. Her arms were thicker, and her hips had a new wiggle to them. Her lean muscle had done a good job supporting her first thirty pounds, but she certainly didn't look like she could pull off the most rigorous of her acrobat techniques with that extra baggage. Ty Lee gave her sweet roll a big lick before shoving the entire thing into her mouth. Toph grinned. "No wonder you're so energetic, all I ever smell around you is sugar!" Ty Lee just sighed with dreamy pleasure as she pulled out the next roll. "It's just all so good! Melt-in-your mouth is the best kind of melting, and you know that's a big deal coming from a Fire Nation girl!" She flashed a smile at Toph, even though she knew she couldn't see it. Toph's senses were acute enough to tell she was getting a grin, though. She could just make out the sound of Ty Lee's lips parting with her heightened senses, and could detect a sugary puff of breath doing a good job of covering up the fact she hadn't brushed her teeth in two days.

Suki sighed. "Fine. One more day. Then its back to work. I better go grab some off-duty clothes...then seconds." She gratefully accepted another plate of fried eggs from Toph and returned to her room.
Suki wasn't as lucky as Ty Lee when it came to how her weight was settling. It seemed her body was hellbent on making her look as tubby as possible with the smallest amount of adipose; her thirty pounds had puffed out her cheeks, thickened her arms, pushed out her chest, and given Suki a potbelly that looked less like a soft extension of feminine curves like Ty Lee and more like an oblong bowling ball jutting out from her midriff. Her butt was certainly bigger, but her hips were too small to outrace her belly, destroying the last semblance of feminine curves on her already tomboyish body, even with the extra weight in her breasts; they looked more wide than round and perky like Ty Lee's girls' did.

Toph turned to Ty Lee when Suki disappeared into the other room. "So, is Katara -still- asleep?" Ty Lee scratched her head with a sticky finger, pulling a few hairs askew on the top of her head. A tiny lick of hair above her forehead remained upright, gelled in place by liquid sugar. "Yeah, I could hear her snoring from outside the inn. She was -really- exhausted looking for me. I guess I could have checked back after I dropped off the orders for the Kiyoshi Warriors, but I just had to swing by that bakery for breakfast!" Toph didn't think the ditzy acrobat had eaten anything other than sweets since she started overeating.

Toph shrugged and shoved a fist-full of bacon into her mouth. When her mouth couldn't hold another cubic centimeter of greasy, crispy perfection, she offhandedly remarked, "Wughen shugurh queen wakes uph, shesh gonna be starvhingh!" The final word was accentuated by a spray of saliva and bacon chunks, some of which landed on Suki's eggs.

Katara still has more to take care of...
1313211111111111111111.content:
The next morning ,Katara was pleased to discover the massive stomach ache from yesterday's raw seafood and butter binge was staring to lose its edge. She admitted to herself that she had succumbed to gluttony for the better half of the previous day. She grew ravenously hungry waddling down to the beach, and all the exercise it required didn't help any either. She wasn't turning heads with her flatulence this time, as, without food for a day, her gassiness plummeted in frequency and no longer sounded like gunpowder being ignited. Even that irritated Katara, though. Part of her had grown accustomed to the warmth and gentle wave of relief she felt every with every few steps since she decided she was physically unable to hold back due to politeness' sake anymore. Upon arriving at the beach, she fished out anything and everything she could after downing a few sticks of butter for bending fuel. (Thank goodness the market opens pretty early on Kiyoshi Island, Katara thought!) She indiscriminately chowed down on koi, raw oysters, occasional tufts of seaweed, some puffer-crab, and what she figured must have been a jellyfishsquid. After eating just about everything the tide brought in with block after block of butter, she let herself collapse into the sand like a bloated sea-mammal and collect her thoughts.

Katara was banking that Suki would see past the euphoria of her first calorie high and order a search for Ty Lee, as she knew Suki possessed pristine sense of motivation and a clear sense of duty to the Kiyoshi Warriors. However, Katara had also once thought she herself had large stores of willpower. At the very least, she considered herself polite. As she lay there, listening to her body churn the mishmash of seafood and oil into more body fat and noisome bursts of gas originating from both her mouth and rear end, she knew the last thing she could call herself at that moment in time was well-mannered. She experienced the harsh sting of her guilt once more, though she was quick to defend herself this time. "It's not like I have a choice; my body needs to process all this food I...can't help but...yeah that sounds right, can't help but eat." But something about her self-talk made Katara even more nervous. She hadn't felt any guilt as she was stuffing her face, only when she was full to bursting did her body seem to let her have thoughts independent of her urges. Even worse, she couldn't help but have a bit of a craving for some chocolate, even as she winced against the stomach cramps that had rapidly developed as she ate and ate and ate.

So, Katara knew that both Suki and Ty Lee,who had the willpower of a child when her acrobatics and other attention-seeking antics weren't involved,may very well be too enraptured by their new urges to fight them, rendering themselves at this point (or at whatever point Katara decided to move her gelatinous butt off the beach to resume the search) too chunky to reverse the chi-block. Katara guessed they must have gotten at least twenty pounds heavier, maybe more. Offhandedly, Katara wondered what parts of them were getting the biggest, as her and Toph had been growing equally soft in very different ways. "Ty Lee's probably going to have boobs as big as my head, judging from those times I saw her in a swimsuit..." Katara muttered half-jealously. At that point Katara's eyes widened as she realized she was sidetracking herself yet again. Knowing that her friends were probably now in the same boat as she had been, Katara decided that there was only one option left; find Azula.

As the sun began to set, Katara felt light(ish) enough to heave herself to a standing position. Her back ached from the exertion, but not as much as her stomach. All the fat that was collecting on her thighs made her feel like she was walking waist-deep in pudding compared to her old, fit self. Smiling to herself as she felt the familiar and comforting bursts of flatulence once again sounding off from her rear as she walked, Katara began her search for the easiest way to contact the government. When she heard that a fire nation steamer was docked at Kiyoshi Island, she immediately decided on a plan. She would inform Zuko that they had been cured of their "affliction" and that they wanted to join in the chase for Azula! She asked for an army-sized battleship, but with only the barest skeleton crew. She also requested to be informed of any sightings of Azula by any of the Earth or Fire kingdom forces, just as if the ship was an on-duty patrol vessel. After the message was given to a fire nation soldier, Katara leisurely made her way down the row of merchant ships, purchasing an armada's worth of provisions for delivery within the week. After all, not having a regiment of soldiers and tanks on board made that much more room for snacks.

Now that it was a new day,Katara examined herself and guessed she had hit 200 pounds, as her belly was now hanging over the upper part of her groin. She definitely added another six inches or so to her hips, and when Katara stopped to pick her underwear out from her doughy butt cheeks, she noticed a couple of small dimples amidst the once smooth light-coffee tinted flesh of her posterior. A few flecks of cellulite that Katara had kept her eye on since she first started plumping up were now beginning to spread; her rear wasn't quite affected by much of it yet but that looked like her future; her inner thighs sported a generous strip of the slightly bumpy flesh, especially in the region -just- under her butt, by the banana rolls. It seemed likely her body wouldn't be able to differentiate her thighs with her rear as it continued its development into what looked like saddlebags. She felt flesh starting to creep under her chin when she looked down, as well. Katara also readjusted her cloth wrappings; the amount she had on could only cover the lower two thirds of her bust now; her breasts had jutted out further and were wide enough force a slit of cleavage through her multiple layers of clothing. Katara noticed her elbows seemed to disappear when she held her arms straight, and her knees seemed to be slowly sinking into their own cradle of flesh.

Sighing, Katara figured she would finally wash herself up now that there was nothing to do but wait...as soon as she grabbed breakfast. Of course, if she spotted Toph and the girls on the way, she would regrettably have to postpone her hygiene yet another night. Tragic, Katara tried to tell herself. Very tragic.

-----

The sunlight streaming through Suki's bedroom window illuminated Toph's triumphant grin."Nope, I didn't slip anything into your food! You slept in and missed drills today all by yourself, Suki!" She wasn't lying, either. Suki had become particularly invested in the day of gorging Toph had laid out for her when it finally clicked with the gluttonous earth-bender what her "favorite" foods were; anything that she was denied as a child growing up in the Kiyoshi warriors! Anything that make Suki spout a line like "Oh, I can never eat that on duty, it makes me lethargic!" or "That's terrible for my complexion, its all fat, no nutrition!" was a food Toph made sure was readily available 24/7. She seemed to have a particular week spot for cheese. After the seventh cheese-steak of her ninth meal of the day, Suki fell into a gluttony-bolstered sleep that not even her discipline could override. Three hours after sunrise, Suki finally began to stir. Toph wasted no time heaving her uncooperative, gassy body into Suki's room to tell her the good news.

Suki, clad in just a pair of green linen shorts and a baggy white night-shirt, moaned with frustration and brought her pillow over her head. After some squirming she eventually got herself to stand up, her bare feet getting the slightest chill as they touched the floor. She scratched at a tiny pink pimple that had appeared on her cheek overnight and let out a heartburn-tinged belch, which Toph couldn't help but inhale deeply; cheese-steak smelled great, and she never smelled anything outside of her own cloud of flatulence lately, so it really didn't register as much different from the real thing to her. Suki winced with slight discomfort. Her hand automatically went to her stomach, which was bulging enough to be outlined in her night-shirt. "I guess I'll go in tomorrow then...I'll have to say I was sick, coming in late will only give the girls wrong ideas."

Toph, still grinning, put her arm around Suki's waist, almost pulling her into her kitchen.(except at doorways, which Toph couldn't fit through with someone else in tow) "Sounds like a plan, bright and early tomorrow you'll be back on track! But for now, you've gotta try what I've got going for breakfast, -uuuurp-!"

13132111111111111111111.content:
Toph had had a pleasant morning making sure Suki ate her fill. The more wildly inappropriate the food Toph presented her with, the more her complaints and calorie intake seemed to increase. By the time she had begun deep-frying pastries Suki was in her own little world. Not even bothering to get out of her pajamas after engorging herself, Suki now reclined in the main room of her house on a cushy futon-like piece of furniture that would be able to seat three if Suki hadn't stretched her body across its entirety, one hand on her bulky midriff, a dazed but pleased look in her eye.

Toph's own stomach demanded more food with an audible rumble and a gassy string of belches. She had of course eaten several pounds of sausage over the course of Suki's meal, but her bustling around the kitchen for Suki gave her fewer opportunities to stuff herself, cutting her consumption down to somewhere around what a normal person would eat in a day's time. She felt a little wrong about this; playing the mommy was much more Katara's deal. In fact, despite the circumstances, Toph guessed Katara would have been a little proud of what she had accomplished over the past few days; she had nurtured a sword-straight (and rapier-skinny!) soldier into a state of immature complacency. It takes a certain degree of doting to accomplish that! The more she thought about it, the happier she was Katara wasn't around to see it; she worked hard to let everyone around her know that she was by no means soft. Even now, she would rankle at the thought of someone using that adjective for anything other than her body. Even then, Toph (all five feet of her) would vastly prefer being called "huge" or "gigantic". Whenever she'd pick up the gossip whispered behind her generously wide back with her acute hearing, she absolutely loved when "pudgy" and "chubby" got drowned out by "big as a house!" and "mammoth!".

Toph's small body had swelled and swelled, placing her in the neighborhood of 175 pounds. For a girl of her height, that much poundage smothered every aspect of her body with a thick slab of fat. Of course, her stomach, which was nearing her knees, was the star attraction. Her baggy green shirt was now skin tight, and still released two inches or so of her snowy-looking flesh to exposure to the outside world. Perhaps more impressive was how wide her stomach was; Toph's upper legs pushed against the curtain of flesh as she walked, so often mid stride she would switch to a waddle, or if she was able to, a little earthbending mobility that required no actual movement of her body aside from a few hand gestures (which Toph found tedious with the bulk that had swallowed up her upper arms, but at least her stomach didn't get in the way...much). Her new chin was a thick U-shaped slab under the natural contour of her face. Whenever Toph turned her head, excess flesh would push to the left or to the right, slightly reducing her head's range of motion. Toph was thankful for her crystal-clear vibrational vision, as if she tried to look down with her eyes, she was sure her double chin would stop part of the effort and her belly would obscure whatever visibility she'd have left. Her lower body was thicker, but Toph guessed one of Katara's legs was almost (but not quite, thanks to Toph's devotion to her gluttony) thick enough to account for both of hers. All in all, Toph's body was wide, almost round, and very cumbersome. Her stomach stopped her from scooting her chairs too close to tables, which frustrated Toph as much as being expected to sit on something like a stool frustrated Katara. Of course, Toph had no problems with just sitting on the floor and eating, legs beginning to splay to make room for her stomach fat. It was the position she had assumed after making sure Suki was properly gorged to gobble up all remaining "leftovers" (Toph rarely made it possible to truly run out of food, even before she started working on Suki). It was also the position in which Katara and Ty Lee found her.

----

Katara stomped over to Toph quickly, causing plate-rattling vibrations on the nearby table. Toph could feel that Katara had, like her, put on a few since their first night at Kiyoshi Island.
She steeled herself for a tongue-lashing, but instead received an extremely level tone of voice from her friend. "I don't need to repeat myself. I think Ty Lee's probably too fat to get cured by now, and Suki didn't sound any better, from her description." The acrobat chimed in, slightly offended. "Hey, I've gained like, half a pound at most! Look, I can still do a cartwheel!" Ty Lee steadied herself, rocked her upper body back and forth, giving her chest a small, rhythmic bounce, and then stumbled a bit, resting her hand on a wall. Ty Lee frowned. "I'll show you guys when I haven't eaten in a while, I can't do it on a full stomach." Ty Lee bent over into a nearby bag, giving Katara a look at her now doubly-wide buttocks, and picked up a danish to nosh on.

Katara put a hand on her cheek shook her head. Turning her attention back to Toph, she calmly explained her plans for Azula's manhunt. Toph raised an eyebrow. "Y'know, that's a good idea. If she can "fix" us, I want no part of it, but I've always wanted a real peace of her, especially with my new bending strength!" Katara nodded, not wanting to say anything to revoke the first agreement they've had that wasn't steak-related in a long time. Ty Lee, who had finished her danish and had taken to sucking on her fingers one-by-one, also gave her assent. "If she looks anything like you guys, she's probably sitting on defenseless townsfolk while pillaging towns of their candy supplies. She's a meanie when she's trying to carry out one of her little plans." Suki, hearing Katara's voice, wandered into the kitchen, hair mussed and feet bare. "I'm coming with you, and so are some of the Kiyoshi warriors; we've gotten good at hunting down that particular menace, I think. Katara's eyes widened; she'd never seen Suki so slovenly before. She also noticed her shoulders and head were inclined slightly past her waist; Suki was slouching! Katara figured it had something to do with her figure,a generous gut and wide, heavy looking breasts, but Toph was quite large around the middle, and even she had the presence of mind to put in the slightest bit of extra effort to hold herself upright. "Of course you both can come. I want you all to review these supply lists; I ordered plenty of food, but..."

All three girls simultaneously darted for the list in Katara's hands. Toph got there first and tried to snatch the list, with the intention of impatiently holding it up for someone to read out loud to her. Ty Lee had already started to demand an array of sweets, and wanted desperately to write "lots of bags of sugar!!!, Oh and sugarcane!" across Katara's neatly printed items. Suki realized cheese might not have shown up on the list, which was now unacceptable to her. All three girls had plowed into Katara, resulting in a rather gassy, wriggling pileup, the force of which knocked a potted plant from the kitchen windowsill. Toph had rolled across Katara's back, making her buck under her weight, pushing her rear the highest into the air as she tried to get her upper body to lift against Toph's stomach, which was now resting on her head! Ty Lee, who had tripped and kneed Katara in the side, fallen into Toph and had pressed her chest into her face. Suki had been almost been thrown clear of the wreckage, but was close enough to dig her hands into one of Katara's generous butt cheeks as a handhold to help her get to her feet. Her shirt had ridden up, revealing her jutting stomach. She couldn't help but cringe a little at the smell; being anywhere close to Katara's butt was comparable to being behind a particularly flatulent mother elephant. However, noticing Katara's ponderous rear end had compressed and adhered to a greasy piece of ham, she couldn't help but peel it off and indulge, her slouch returning once she finally righted herself.

Ty Lee spoke first after the human crash. "Girls , I wish I could say you all look and smell better up close, but I think we should just put the list on the table. No huddling over it either!" Toph chose this moment to belch into Ty Lee's cleavage, releasing a noise that sounded much like a raspberry and sending a ripple through her chest's fat reserves. Ty Lee jumped back, a little startled by the force of Toph's point-blank belch.

131321111111111111111111.content:
Zuko stormed across the Fire Nation capital’s impressive throne room, scattering advisors and guardsmen with barked orders. “I forbid it! If they’re going to hunt down Azula, then I’m going with them! Cancel their supply orders and get me my armor!” Zuko’s vehemence was enough to prompt Mai to stroll almost lazily into the chamber, barring his exit from the room directly in front of the doorway. Her voice had little more enthusiasm than her body language. “So…you’re going off to stop Azula from taking over the fire nation.” Zuko stopped short and raised an eyebrow. “You can put it that way. I expect that’s her ultimate goal.” Mai gave Zuko a second to put two and two together, then continued when met with silence. “So you believe the country will be best protected with the emperor and only firebender who has defeated Azula one-on-one sailing around aimlessly away from the capital with the better part of the military?”

Zuko’s eyes narrowed. He opened his mouth to shout something, then slumped his shoulders ever so slightly and relaxed his expression. “Azula’s not stupid, Mai. She’s not going to charge in and face me until she knows she can win. I don’t like sitting around like this, stagnating, waiting for her to lay some trap for Aang or Katara! She’s not above finding a way to kidnap you for bargaining power, either!” Mai looked into Zuko’s eyes with sincerity, her voice becoming clear and direct. “I know. She was my close friend for a long time. I won’t let myself compromise the safety of you or the Fire Nation. She gave a little smile. “Besides,” Mai put a hand on her hips. “The way I lounge around the palace all day, I’ll probably be too fat to kidnap; my butt just won’t be able to get through the windows.”

1313211111111111111111111.content:
As Zuko and Mai discussed their options, the outskirts of the fire nation were burning to the ground. The aged, pristine forest in which Aang and Co. had thwarted the rebel Jet’s terrorism against an Earth Kingdom settlement had become immolated, the flames spreading so quickly that in a few moments the sight of the conflagration would be visible to anyone in the surrounding geography who happened to glance in the forest’s direction. The wall of flame seemed to malevolently wall off the previously-threatened earth kingdom settlement, denying its inhabitants escape in either direction.

And then, the flames stood still. The smoke seemed to die down, making the fire harder to see from a distance. The fire itself did not extinguish; the forest town was still encircled by a noose of hungry flame. While the town had been heavily flooded during Aang, Katara and co’s encounter with Jet, the state of peace that existed since the defeat of Ozai and Azula had allowed for a speedy reconstruction. The town had grown quite populous with Earth Kingdom citizens who grew tired of city life, but were not inured to living in a desert or port town. As Azula stepped out of the burning foliage into the town, she was glad for this. Amongst the crowd she could glimpse potbellied diplomats and doughy housewives, fearfully clutching the arms and shoulders of pudgy, spoiled children. The last town she had hit had been closer to the desert, its inhabitants largely miners and explorers. When she and her followers had scoured the town for crops and virtually anything else edible, they found barely enough sustenance to qualify as a successful raid. However much Azula delighted in seeing an entire town’s population cower in fear and flee before her might, if she wasn’t able to find a way to get any fatter from the venture, it was a self-indulgent waste of time as far as she was concerned.

The sight of Azula stepping through the archway into town added to the surrealism of static ring of burning trees; unless the lone, armored girl approaching the frightened populace was fantastically strong, she should not have been able to step so surely and so quickly, as she appeared almost too fat to stand, let alone march. While the sight invited puzzlement, the approaching figure also very much radiated malicious intent. The town watch, a dozen soldiers led by a trio of earthbenders, stepped forward in warning to the invader. When she raised a hand and began a bending gesture, the guards quickly sent a flurry of arrows punctuated by a hail of razor-sharp rocks manipulated by the bending guardsmen. Without breaking stride, a gout of blue flame leapt from the porcine girl’s lips, filling the cone of space directly in front of her with roaring flame that was not only stopping the arrows by setting their shafts aflame but incinerating everything that had been directed towards her; not even the rock remained when the fiery breath dissipated.

The captain of the guard, having once seen a truly powerful firebender during his tour of duty in the Earth Kingdom military, shouted to the nearby townspeople to flee towards the southern walls as quickly as possible, then ordered his men to fall back, confident a direct encounter would be the end of them.
By the time the town scattered, Azula had reached the settlement’s main plaza, where the soldiers had launched their assault from. Putting a hand to the generous sac of fat that had replaced her chin, she clicked her tongue. “I need to widen my breastplate again…though that was effective…if not completely dignified.” Unbeknownst to the town guard, the deadly-hot fire breath she had produced had in fact been an unintentional belch. The tightness of her otherwise perfectly-sized armor around her midriff did not help with the frequency of these outbursts, though if she concentrated she could typically avoid sending forth a gout of fiery death from her lips (or, if she wasn’t careful, her hindquarters).

These unintentional bouts of firebending were a testament to the effectiveness of her newfound calorie-bending. She could use her own body’s caloric reserves to amplify her bending powers, even going so far as to manipulating the metabolic processes in her body. Her body’s muscles were still those of her fit and lean physique, unused to carrying extra weight. By burning up calories at a faster rate however, she found she could renew her body’s endurance. Her muscles were constantly refreshed and regenerated, though simply standing now burnt calories as if she was engaged in a brisk run. Azula was confident she could create a fireball strong enough to breach the nigh-impenetrable outer wall of Ba Sing Se, but doing so would likely leech two hundred pounds of body fat from her frame in a matter of seconds. Such power was intoxicating but short lived…unless she had a very, very large supply of calories.
That was why Azula had begun to ravage town after town, port after port. She would shed a few pounds crushing any resistance and spreading fear and confusion amongst the populace, much as she had done today with her forest fire (control of which had already whisked away ten pounds of precious softness from her body, but did little to alleviate her painfully tight armor) then take back her investment in force by stripping the settlement of any and all edible materials, cooking cattle into steaks where they stood and pouring entire bags of sugar down her gullet one after the other, too consumed by her new bending style to ever feel anything close to contentment with how much she had eaten. By the time she was through she’d be several pounds heavier than when she began, sometimes managing to swell by nearly one hundred pounds. Getting to her ideal weight was harder than this would indicate, however. She’d often lose twenty pounds simply traveling from place to place as it took more and more energy to keep her body mobile. Even with this caviat, Azula’s natural cunning had allowed to her balloon to over 500 pounds using these tactics. The fugitive princess knew she needed to be much, much heftier to ensure a clean victory against the combined forces of the Fire nation military, her traitorous family and friends, and the Avatar, bolstered by his gaggle of followers.

The idea of growing so large troubled Azula not one whit; it was simple fact that her beauty was unparalleled. If she chose to drape herself in a few extra thousand pounds, every ounce would amplify her regal beauty.
Where things stood now, her rear end doubled Katara’s in width, supported by thighs that put tree trunks to shame (Azula knew this well, as she often found herself having to squeeze her majestic legs between two closely situated trees just to have a way to move through the forest). Before today’s attack, Azula noticed she could now grab a thick handful of fat from her ankles, of all places. Of course, it wasn’t surprising considering the pace at which the rest of her “beauty” had been developing. If it were not for the extra energy she was expending bracing her muscles, her breasts would leave her Azula nearly unable to walk in their own right. They rested in her armor, jutting forward with her stomach, the rigid lining of her crimson chestplate keeping them from simply resting against her gut, instead pressing them together and keeping them relatively supported, sculpting a cleavage line that likely outstripped a foot in length. Her arms had thickened past what even the most well-muscled earthbender could ever hope to achieve, creating delicate wings of hanging flab whenever she raised her arms. Her elbows had disappeared into delicate creases several days ago, lagging behind the disappearance of her knees. Her stomach had widened, then drooped, unwilling to completely overthrow dominance of her hips in terms of width, choosing instead to sprout generous lovehandles then venture outward, never achieving the jut and heft of Toph’s midsection in favor of a thick, flawless curtain of jelly that hung like an apron over her upper thighs. Her footfalls often cracked the delicate tile of the bakeries and restaurants she raided. Azula had come to love the sound of her heavy footfalls; to her, the bassy crashing rhythm spoke of power.

Despite her generous bulk, Azula had appeared at every invasion fully armored, clad in a deep burgundy and gold one-piece suit of that covered the entirety of her truly massive rear end and even managed to gently wrap around her stomach with an extra extension of the plating that was separate from the “skirt” portion protecting her hips and upper thighs. Underneath this she wore massive crimson-dyed silk garments that covered her arms and legs completely, sewn from the entirety of a looted bolt of cloth. Her armor was custom-made, a series of interlocking metal strips and hexagons bound together by tiny catches. Using a special tool that “unlocked” an armor segment through an almost imperceptible slot on its face, she could undo an offending portion of her armor and reconnect tit with wider angles, allowing space for yet more armor strips. The end result was protective gear that cradled her body perfectly, growing bigger and bigger with her body. She had held a fire nation metalworker’s family hostage, denying him sleep and food for over 24 hours until she was sure she had enough armor-tiles to make twenty normal breastplates. Azula had taken the liberty of shaping hand and shin guards out of the tiles as well. It was this armor in which Azula now stood, ready to overtake a particularly prosperous mark.

13132111111111111111111111.content:
Azula did not hesitate long in the town square. Even as she stood she felt her precious fat stores slowly leeching away. It would take days before her body would noticeably begin to slim down in this manner, but the thought of her power bleeding out, squandered on keeping her standing and holding up all her beauty, was maddening. Azula knew her discomfort would be short lived, however, for as she gleefully devoured every last consumable worth a calorie within the town’s confines, adding pound after pound of bending fuel to her body, she would be paving the way to a world whose sole purpose was keeping her fed. She wouldn’t have to spend any calories at all; the throne room of the Fire Nation’s palace would be filled with cushions and become her new throne. The civilized world would grow rail-thin as they labored in fear and awe, providing Phoenix Lord Azula with her Endless Feast. Grinning to herself, she awaited the arrival of those loyal to her, so that she may properly pluck and devour her newest fruit of victory. The hunger that came with her bending style was a powerful thing, and if properly administered, Azula found it was more effective than outright mind control; any young lady she brought under her spell would stare longingly at her obese body, willing to do whatever she asked in return for a seat at her endless feast once she was in power.

Rapidly, a pack young women around Azula’s age, armored as well as their eclectically out-of-shape bodies would allow, had followed Azula into the town, fanning out to begin a pillage. The entirety of the group had been “broken” by Azula using a combination of intimidation, overwhelming bending prowess, and a desire to indulge their newfound gluttony. All of them had once tried to stop her, or had the misfortune of being in her way during her travels. Watching their plump bodies disappear into the city, Azula knew that if she wasn’t around, her little raiding party would indulge a bit on their own as they started gathering up food for her. While she didn’t want her troops getting too fat too quickly, knowing only the firebenders in the group would have any ability to artificially enhance their mobility with her bending techniques, she knew they would surely lash out at her if they weren’t able to indulge their growing inclination towards gluttony in some small way. Even under Azula’s watchful eye, the most seasoned of her raiders were getting rather porcine; former Earth Kingdom soldiers who had been with her since her escape from Ba Sing Se had been on enough successful raids to swell themselves into obesity. Some were almost half as fat as Azula, which was, by all means, an accomplishment.

Pleased with how smooth the raid was going and the prospective size of her coming meal, Azula indulged in a drawn-out gust of flatulence. For all of her willpower and bodily control, she couldn’t help but enjoy the sensation, especially with her armor needing an alteration, the metal plates pressing uncomfortably into her stomach through her silks. Her eyes flicked to a now-abandoned restaurant across the plaza. She set off on a brisk march, the swaying of her rear end hidden by her armor. A dull swoosh-thud accompanied each step as her thighs rubbed against each other intensely, then gently struck the underside of her armored belly. As Azula grew closer and closer to the first bite of her city-spanning binge, her regal composure began to crack. Distracted by the sweet smells of coffee and fresh-baked bread wafting from the eatery, Azula’s caloriebending began to slip from lack of concentration. Her breathing became more and more audible, eventually becoming gasps as she grew increasingly out of breath. Beads of sweat began to sparkle on her forehead, and she unconsciously began licking her lips as her mouth flooded with saliva. She practically stumbled into the restaurant, stopping to rest against a wooden table, nearly snapping it in two with her bulk. As her back flared with pain from holding up so much weight, Azula refocused her bending, waddling into the kitchen.

The restaurant was picked clean in ten minutes flat. By the time Azula stumbled out from the establishment, her thighs holding her in place for one maddening moment at the doorframe, several barrels of butter, salt, and sugar had been located and placed in the plaza so that Azula, half-senseless with hunger, would not grow displeased.

----
After two hours of feasting, Azula couldn’t take it anymore. “Someone pull their face from their trough and unclasp my armor for me!” Azula’s hands were otherwise occupied with bending a light flame over a basin filled with sticks of butter, melting the sticks into over a gallon of fatty oil. “If I don’t get some help right now I’ll consider it an assassination attempt! It’s practically strangling me!” Her orders sent saliva flying from her lips, her cheeks and chins remaining quivering long after she stopped barking at the half-dozen girls who had completed their food collecting jobs and had taken to gobbling down whatever food they could before Azula inevitably reached their pile. A shapely, but noticeably overweight figure rose up from behind Azula and deftly unclasped her armor, freeing an ocean of crimson-wrapped flab. Azula’s breasts fell heavily onto her stomach with a wet slap, no longer pressed together by the unyielding metal of the breastplate. Her entire garment was saturated with sweat, deepening the reds of her outfit to a near-black. Azula sighed with pleasure, letting more noxious air vent from her rear.

“You don’t pay or feed me enough to be your handmaiden.” June, a bounty hunter once tasked with capturing the Avatar, rounded Azula’s bulk to make eye contact. Azula grunted, unhappy that someone’s insolence was between her and her current bowl of butter. She had sat down in front of the pile of food and deactivated her bending as well, which did not help with her patience; she was riotously hungry, and without her bending control she just couldn’t stop sweating. June returned Azula’s icy stare with the eye that wasn’t covered by her waterfall of raven-black hair, letting out a gong-strike of a belch as she did so. “I’m taking a few extra bags of sugar, okay? I still don’t know what you did to me, but I need them to scratch an itch.” June gestured to her double-belted leather vest. One belt had snapped long ago, the other creating a monstrous muffin top around a midriff that seemed to be dying to escape. Despite this, her gut did not dominate her figure; that job was left to her breasts. Despite only gaining about a hundred pounds in Azula’s service so far, they had already begun to pull downward, too weighty to rest perkily in her clothes.

Azula’s temper flared as June turned away from her, displaying her meaty but not oversized buttocks and thick (impressively so, for someone so top-heavy) thighs. From within the generous flesh of her face, the firebender’s voice turned remarkably icy. “You’re working for me because you can’t stop eating, and because I overpowered you and burnt the noise hairs off that disgusting animal you ride around. You’re ‘working’ for me because you would be a pathetic wreck without me by now!” June stopped and turned. A hint of sadness played across her relatively slender face, but was quickly erased by her long training as a bounty-hunter. She tried to act natural by using a plump arm to wipe some sweat off her forehead before giving her damp armpit a sniff. She then turned back to Azula. “True, but you can’t deny it. Even with all this extra weight, I took care of those guards after you scared them away with your…uuuuuraaap…womanly charms.” June fanned the air in front of her own face, partly for emphasis, partly because she realized she kind of smelt bad nowadays. Azula snorted (this expression came very easily to her at this point). “The less work I do, the faster we win our eternal gluttony. Take your bag of sugar, and if you use that tone with me again, I will show you the true extent of my ‘Womanly Charms’ as you call them.” Azula mimed blowing June a kiss, letting a lightning-fast fireball escape her lips as she brought her hand away, caramelizing a the bag of sugar that June had been (awkwardly) bending down to pick up.

“…still good…” June simply uttered, her expression unfazed. Grabbing the smoldering hunk of gooey sugar and using her prodigious strength to cram her cream-colored breasts deeper into her leather vest, June began enjoying her spoils of war as a delightful river of butter washed down Azula’s gullet.

Katara and co. were granted their supplies, and the ship they had requested was supplied to them. In addition to Katara, Toph, Ty Lee, and Suki, fifteen Kiyoshi warriors were rounded up by their commander. Suki managed to reassume her aura of leadership to assign the Kiyoshi warriors a job rotation on the ship, then set them to work as the steamer un-docked. This was not before Suki declared that keeping a ship running was difficult in full body armor, and declared that the frontal plate armor worn by the Kiyoshi would only be mandatory if they were warned of an approaching, unknown vessel. As her charges dispersed, Suki let her posture curve into a slouch, and unbuckled her breastplate, her gelatinous gut no longer in a vise. Suki then waddled up to Toph, who had taken several fifty-pound blocks of clay aboard and was busy bending them into a recliner. Toph lifted up her green shirt over her belly after realizing it was only covering half of it anyway in a reclining position. Suki wondered how Toph was capable of walking...or even if she was. She walked up the ramp to the ship, sure, but she took breaks and often leaned against Katara (Much to her chagrin, but she wasn't moving any faster, albeit without leaning on things). Toph used her earthbending to haul herself around Kiyoshi in the days following the letter's return to Zuko, sometimes supporting her gut with a mobile shelf of rock, other times just plopping herself down and letting a wave of earth ferry her about. Katara, often lagging behind her and sweating bullets, chastised Toph plenty for not getting any exercise, but Toph was never the most attentive when it came to corrective advice.

Toph sluggishly shifted on her makeshift throne. "Heya Suki." Suddenly, a coil of moving clay appeared behind her and shaped itself into a wide, plush looking chair. The clay on the seat, arms, and back was bended so that it was just slightly soft, leaving the softness coating Suki's body unmolested by sharp corners or hard surfaces. Suki guessed Toph's throne was also Mattress-soft. She put her feet up, and Toph produced a clay footstool within a second. Knife-thin clay fans began to hover around Toph's bloated frame, fanning her face, chins, and the peak of her belly, which was large enough to partially shield Toph from the sun. The fans kept a steady stream of Toph B.O. coming her way, especially when she got gassy or when the fans approached her feet, but even that was growing on her. "So, I've gotta say, you really are packing it away lately, Suki! I thought you'd put up more of a fight."

Suki thought fondly about the fifteen additional pounds she had put on just while the supplies were being delivered. "Well, all my life things have been discipline, discipline, discipline. When I saw Katara so big, I realized that there was no way letting myself go a little would ruin my life. So, here we are!" Toph grinned. "You took to it like a duck to water! Open wide!" A floating clay bowl began to tip a pile of chocolate-covered vegetables into Suki's mouth. Suki cringed a little. "Veggies?" Toph cocked a thumb in the general direction of the supply hold. "Katara is still trying to get me to drop a few. Anything that didn't want to make you lick your fingers afterwards I doused in chocolate. I figured you might be able to stomach some of it before I order it all thrown overboard, that way we can pick up more lard at the next port. Waste not!"
Suki shrugged. "Well the chocolate's good..." "-It's extra rich!" Ty Lee called from across the deck, enjoying some of the choco-veggies herself. Suki let a grunt of flatulence out. Ty Lee had also put on a good 15 pounds, but her hips and chest swelled faster than her belly, making her look thick but perhaps less bulky than she really was. "...but it gives me gas." Toph emitted a belch of her own. "You know you're doing something right when everything starts giving you gas!"

Meanwhile Katara was cursing herself. She wanted to be mad at Suki and Ty Lee for gaining so much weight in just two days, but she had thrown on nearly thirty pounds after she had sent the supply letter away. It was legitimately difficult to walk, bordering on painful for her leg muscles. She kept at it, but it definitely wasn't helping her figure. If anything, the futile attempt at exercise only fueled her appetite. She wondered if she could even do anything now to stop herself or Toph from completely losing themselves to their new-found desires. Katara felt numb whenever she wasn't eating, and truthfully she had hundreds of opportunities to bathe in Kiyoshi; its just that the thought of soap scum and scalding water washing away the lubricating coating of sweat from her body or exposing her nostrils to air that wasn't infused with her own body's concoctions had managed to become disgusting to her. She also took a quiet joy in letting herself be freely flatulent; every time she passed gas, it was as if she was a little lighter, and her stomach that much less achy. Thinking of all this, for the first time, she looked on at Toph with admiration rather than disgust. It really was quite nice to lay around, no matter how quickly it would disintegrate muscle, and really there was no problem with being a little...pungent if everyone around you didn't care....Katara tried to pull herself out of her daydream, realizing her urges were taking over again when she began to envy Toph's belly, wondering how much she would need to eat to get it that big and soft and...hilly.

Katara bit her lip. "Gotta get a grip....I guess I have no choice, time to gorge a bit more, shut these urges down for a little..."

1313211111111111111111111111.content:
The steamer was a week into its journey, and for the sailors and Kiyoshi warriors accompanying Katara, Toph, Suki, and Ty Lee on their hunt for Azula, the upper cabins of the steamer ship were fast becoming the only tolerable place to rest. Many of the lower holds had been packed wall-to-wall with crates of food, Even though the main cabins were more spacious, Toph and co. taking up residence in a few was enough to make the entire level foul smelling and uncomfortable. Most of the time they were also choked with smoke from the near-constant food preparation taking place in the galley and on the main deck.

For one Kiyoshi warrior in particular, the whole setup was borderline unbearable. Liu, a short, almost ghostly-looking enlistee of 15, had to blink back tears whenever her shift for patrol or food transport was up. Being an exceptionally lithe and patient, she was often the first assigned to scouting duty and the last for any head-on confrontations. The work made her willowy arms pulse with burning pain, and more often than not she was seasick and prone to skipping meals, which only made her constitution worse. She didn't want to blame her best friend, but she definitely did not jump at the opportunity to board the ship when it was presented by commander Suki.


Neither of them having left Kiyoshi, her closest friend and fellow warrior Song, two years her senior, insisted they take the opportunity to see the world. Song wasn't much more imposingly built than Liu, but her sun-kissed skin, bright hazel eyes, and shoulder-length, slightly tangled brown hair instantly marked her as the more assertive of the pair; Liu's inky-black bangs covered part of her face when not clipped up for duty, and she had a bad habit of staring at her feet when not at attention. It had been Song's idea to go on the trip, but Liu knew that she only suggested it because she thought they both would enjoy time away from Kiyoshi Island.

Liu grit her teeth and marched down to the main floor to meet Song before going to work hefting crates of provisions up to the main deck. What little color she did have drained from her cheeks as she inhaled the smoke, salt, and lingering flatulence in the air of the main holds. Song, possessing a sounder constitution, was quick to strike up a conversation. "So, Rou Lan and Wen were ordered off their night shifts, so I'm stuck hauling boxes for the next four hours." Liu's eyes widened. "How did that happen? And I'm sorry to say it but better you than me, I would keel over hour three." Song gave a dismissing hand gesture. "When I asked them in the flesh, they just shrugged at me and gave this -annoying- little giggle. They must have weaseled an early lunch out of the commander too, I saw them waltzing down to the kitchens. " A large wave pounded the side of the steamer, and Liu's stomach gave a little flip. "....Don't talk to me about lunch break." Liu murmured.

After a back-breaking two hours of hauling up butter and preserved meat, Liu's shift was over. "I'm heading up to my cabin Song, want me to bring you something to drink while you finish your double-shift?" Song, slightly winded but still in command of her wiry strength, shook her head. "Nah. This is what we get for stopping to take on even more supplies at Omashu for two days; what is our commander thinking? Urgh, anyway, I'll be up when I'm done."

---

Liu was beginning to drift into a sound, exhaustion-fueled sleep when the door to her cabin gently swung open. "Hey Liu, I figured out how to get those extra breaks from the commander!" sang Song's voice from the doorway, after a little belch.

Liu was quickly dragged from her bed down to the cloying atmosphere of the ship's main level. Even at night multiple cookfires were active, giving Liu no relief. "At least let me get my overcoat back on Song, I'm just in my bedtime clothes!" Liu's quiet voice was muffled by the sound of a large amount of meat sizzling blasting from the galley doors at the end of the hall. Song finished the fried bread she had been munching on as she lead Liu down into the ship. "That smells so good!" she couldn't help but utter. Liu felt a stab of anxiety. "Song, you hate meat! You've been on a steady veggies and fish diet since you were seven..." Song seemed reluctant to speak for a moment, then shrugged. "I dunno. Acquired a taste for it today, I guess. The commander's been spreading the word that capturing Azula won't be any trouble at all since she dosen't have any nation's military backing, so she's been encouraging us all to let loose a little. You just need to let Ty Lee adjust some pressure points to help with circulation, and you get full access to the galley, plus half shifts!" Liu noticed they were heading toward the upper deck, where commander Suki, Ty Lee, and her rather heavy friends were fond of staying. "This doesn't sound like the commander, Song.." A voice she recognized answered before Song did. "Suki's turned over a new leaf!"

Coming in from the deck was Fei Lin, an older Kiyoshi warrior who could kick like a mule and out-eat most of the men on Kiyoshi Island. She had always been a tall, muscular, and slightly thick-waisted girl, but the Fei Lin that stood before her now was far bigger than the girl of recent memory. Her already somewhat round face and thick thighs had widened severely, and the bottom of her stomach, which resembled a big, squishy pillow stuffed underneath her robe, had become so tight she could see her bellybutton through the cloth. The large girl's silverish eyes darted to Song. "Woah, looking good there!" Fei Lin stepped forward and gave Song's stomach a slap. It was only then that Liu noticed her friend seemed to have eaten to the point of pushing her stomach out, making a distinct shape inside her loosely fitting sailor's shirt. Her look of approval died swiftly when her eyes turned to Liu. Fei Lin stepped into Liu's path, putting her face to face with a pair of swollen, heavy looking breasts. Liu's back hurt just looking at them. "You better go see Ty Lee fast, before you're given all the extra work we're being relieved of!" Liu found that Fei Lin smelled strongly of perspiration and fried food. Her breath was no more fragrant. "Hey, lay off her Fei Lin, she's gonna go now!" Fei Lin belched into the air, gave Song a nod, and hefted her new, more cumbersome body down into the bowels of the ship. Liu blushed watching her weighty rear end heave back and forth through her robe as she descended the nearby set of stairs to the holds.

Song cracked open the door to the deck. It was dark, but torches and hanging lamps had illuminated the front deck. A cool breeze danced through the hall, but the "fresh" air smelt of grease and salt, and did little to calm Liu's churning stomach. "Listen, Song, I'm not feeling so good, I'll see her tomorrow morning!" Song put a fist to her mouth to belch. " -Urpmgh- Well, whatever you want Liu, here's hoping you don't get morning watch!"

131321111111111111111111111111.content:
Liu absolutely did not visit Ty Lee the next morning. In fact, she had purposely avoided that doorway for two days now. Fearful by nature, her mind darted to the most fatal scenarios. The commander, normally so fast to get a new recruit into fighting shape, was letting more and more of her command off their duties. What could be the reason for this? What were so many of the Avatar's former companions doing on a fire nation steamer without the Avatar himself? Azula had reportedly kept the commander locked up as a prisoner under her personal watch during the war; could Suki, upon hearing of her escape, become overwhelmed psychologically? Was the entire steamer to be delivered to Azula, once everyone aboard the ship was bedridden, shoving food into their faces with arms that had so much fat and so little muscle that they struggled to transfer handfuls of bacon and pastries to gaping, slobbering mouths?The idea of it was ridiculous...a week ago, before she saw Suki's friends.

Upon their arrival aboard the ship, Liu knew Katara and Toph had gained a monstrous amount of weight since their victory over the Fire Lord, but she wouldn't deny their right to a life of leisure after putting their lives at risk for so long, after fighting so hard. She almost envied them; they had become heroes, and let their bodies make sure the world knew that they had paid whatever debt to society they may have had, and were now occupied solely with enjoying life. That life was not for her, however. She had always wanted to make a difference in the world. She needed something practical. She ended up turning her back from the family bakery to enlist in the Kiyoshi warriors. It was her life's purpose to stay in prime physical condition to be able to uphold order and keep her family safe from harm. Liu wondered if she would feel the same way if she had made her goal in life perpetuating the family business; if she didn't join the warriors and instead chose to help her family, would she let herself grow a little softer every day on mouth-watering pastries as a reward for her hard work? The more responsibilities her older sister Lan Wen took on at the bakery, the closer she came to being able to fit in their mother's dresses. Even little Kaien, turning 12 next month, was growing in a tummy as she became an expert at frosting the many cakes and buns that they nurtured into dessert perfection every morning. While Liu patrolled the island in the cold seaside mornings, the rest of her family were sipping through mugs of drinking chocolate and sopping up the dregs with warm breakfast rolls.

Liu thought her plump (-ing) family was perfectly natural given their occupation, but now, she was starting to see warriors with baker's bodies. She heard whispers about how large the commander was becoming, but she was too fearful to go see for herself. What was she going to do, tell off her commanding officer? The thought of Commander Suki weakening up the ship for Azula kept crossing Liu's mind, but she just couldn't bring herself to voice her fears to other Kiyoshi Warriors. It was becoming harder to look for clues as well; she had been assigned an extra half-hour of daily work both nights after Song had tried to bring her to Suki and Ty Lee. Song herself hadn't come up to visit Liu in her cabin again, and was no longer spotted at work. The only time Liu saw her since that night was in the mess hall, and even then she didn't try and speak to her. Song was sitting at table packed with gorging Kiyoshi Warriors. Because they were there and sticky with dried sugar, Suki ran her tongue across Ty Lee’s fingers while they happened to be so close to her mouth. “Oh, hey, that tickles!” Ty Lee pulled her hand away and gave it an experimental slurp herself. “Hey, you are right though Suki, tastes like my delicious breakfast!” she shoved her pointer into her mouth and caressed it with her tongue. She cringed a bit. “And a little like your breakfast, now...” Suki was beginning to feel out of breath with the acrobat’s flabby behind pressing on her midsection. “Is there a reason you’re still on top of me?!” the commander barked. “Oh, right! It’s time for inspections, Suki! You’re supposed to go around and check on how the rest of the ship is doing, since you haven’t already, for once.” Ty Lee pulled a lollipop out of her glistening cleavage and put her tongue to work again.

Suki groaned. Toph stopped her incessant gorging for another moment to be protective. “She doesn't have to move a muscle of she doesn't want to! Any of those Kiyoshi who think good commanders need to do stupid things like stumble around nitpicking at their crews all day can answer to me! Let Katara do the worrywart stuff, she'll do it even if you don't ask, trust me!" Toph tried to cross her arms, but it was simply too much flesh in one place. Toph figured taking the time and effort to slide her arms a bit was intimidating enough, anyway. Suki thought about it for a moment. “I suppose it would help with morale, maybe get a few more of the crew to try out the chi block...and once that happens, they’ll all see the..practicality of my new style of command!” Suki reasoned. Ty Lee hiccuped. “Yeah! I wanna pick up more sweet buns from the kitchen anyway. Let’s go!” Suki’s eyes rolled back in pleasure as Ty Lee’s weight vanished from on top of her. The acrobat’s feet hit the deck with a loud thud, sending her belly quivering and her chest into a massive up-then-down jump that made a few chubby Kiyoshi in the process of dropping off more food look mournfully down at their own figures. Ty Lee caught girls lapsing into those kinds of expressions around her pretty much her whole life (at least in those precious moments away from her sisters), and was generally invigorated by the attention.
“Hey, you still aren’t up?” Ty Lee complained. Suki was gleefully accepting a river of melted cheese with strips of kebob meat floating in it via a drain formed by clay, courtsey Toph and the massive bowl of soup she ordered up from the kitchens for the next segment of her breakfast. “Ty Lee, you know what happens when you walk around too much? You get skinny! She’s not leaving until she has some energy food! -Burraap-!”
Ty Lee desperately wanted to go into the holds of the ship where sugary bliss awaited her. Her eyes caught a pair of chi-blocked Kiyoshi emerging onto the decks; one was delightfully bottom-heavy, though the other was barely paunchy. “Oh hey...Eyri right? You let me work on your chi just a few days ago!” The small girl blushed and nodded. “Thank you again...I have more friends now...” she squeaked out sheepishly. The heavier girl put her arm on Eyri’s shoulder. “Sorry she’s still so skinny Ty Lee! Tell the commander Fei Lin is starting to give the new girls quotas to meet so that their appetites ramp up faster than normal, since the process is so slow in the beginning...” Eyri nodded, looked like she wanted to say something, but instead belched in Ty Lee’s face, causing little reaction from the acrobat. Eyri grew immediately apologetic. “I’m sorry! I’ve been eating big breakfasts...” she looked downcast. Ty Lee put a hand on her hip and angled her eyes diagonally upward, as if she were feigning ignorance of the event. With a childlike smile she ripped a boisterous fart, batting her eyelashes in mock femininity. “What were you sorry about?” Ty Lee asked, still smiling. Both girls smiled while Eyri giggled, relaxed by their fellow warrior’s guileless attitude. “Say, would you guys do me a favor?” Ty Lee asked. The pair of them nodded before they heard the request.

-----

"Let's go to the mess hall first!" Ty Lee called back as Suki walked across the deck, supported under each arm by a Kiyoshi warrior. "My back still aches." Suki lamented. She turned to Eyri, who was already red in the face from how much weight the flabby but perfectly mobile commander was putting on her body. "Eyri,right? Could you hold out your arm and kind of prop up my chest?" Suki asked. Eyri's knees trembled, her breathing reluctant from her proximity to the commander's damp armpit. "I...I don't think I can, commander....." the small-boned Kiyoshi mustered. Suki gave another long sigh. "Well, let's hurry to the mess hall then, at least we can sit and eat there." The party's stomachs, even Eyri's, collectively growled at the thought.
13132111111111111111111111111111111.title: A bit of time passes...

131321111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Well, I see nothing wrong here." Suki announced to the dozen flabby Kiyoshi waiting on her hand and foot as she reclined with her hands behind her head across an impressively wide metal bench. “Commander, aren’t you supposed to take a look around first?” Eyri, tasked with giving the commander a foot rub by some of her heavier compatriots, couldn't’even see the commander’s face over her jiggling stomach when crouching down to provide the massage. “I saw the whole room when I walked in. If I spend all day scrutinizing each and every part of the ship i’d never get anything done!” Eyri suddenly felt heavy footsteps slam rapidly up from behind her. “What are you doing questioning the commander? Have you even eaten anything since you’ve gotten here, anyway?” Eyri turned and stood up anxiously to come face-to-chest with Fei Lin. “Well, I am hungry...I just didn’t want to leave the commander’s side...” Eyri felt nauseous again; she had just gotten used to the commander’s pungent self, but Fei Lin’s breath was making her reel all over again. “Sit down, the commander wants a healthy crew. The improvements to your Chi won’t help if you don’t hurry up and eat.” Fei Lin snatched a half-eaten sweet roll out of a nearby Kiyoshi’s hand and drove it into Eyri’s mouth, then pinched Eyri’s nose with her grubby fingers, forcing her to swallow or cease to breathe.

Across the cafeteria Ty Lee was observing this spectacle with a few of her closer Kiyoshi friends. “Suki gets all the attention when she’s down here...is it her zits that everyone likes? The sleeping all the time thing?” Ty Lee took a scoop of sugar and piled it on top of her fried eggs and bacon. After an experimental bite, she added two more. Her friend Tasanee gave an empathetic shrug. “I don’t know! I guess it’s like a fashion trend, like all the rich women in Ba Sing Se follow. I never thought the Kiyoshi would be up for it, what with the facepaint and all...I guess that’s not really a rule anymore though, huh. Not that I’m complaining!” Tasanee indicated to the bright green hair ties that created a pair of chestnut pigtails above her lightly tanned face. A spoiled rich girl from Ba Sing Se, Tasanee’s somewhat misguided ambition for adventure and fame eventually led her to the Kiyoshi. Upon Ty Lee’s arrival, they had become fast friends in any environment where they were not competing for attention with their buxom figures and easy-going attitudes. Ty Lee often shielded Tas from the wrath of Suki for her somewhat lackadaisical approach to her duties while Tasanee in turn let Ty Lee borrow her clothes and provided the choicest gossip when they met off-duty. Ty Lee watched her friend add a pile of sugar to her pancakes. “Ooh, that looks good!” Ty Lee commented. Tasanee nodded, giving her exposed, softened stomach a slap. “You’re the one who gave me the idea.” Ty Lee nodded with a big smile, then opened one eye. “ Wait a sec, I never Chi Blocked you, did I?” Tasanee shrugged. “No, but I’ve never been asked to!” Ty Lee glanced over to Fei Lin, who was now pouring fish stew into Eyri’s mouth as she kicked impotently at her broad, doughy body.

“But we’ve been eating the same things all this time!” Ty Lee glanced down at Tasanee’s wide thighs and swollen breasts. She was at least twenty pounds lighter than her friend, but she had still gotten rather chunky in a short time. Tasanee shrugged. “Your meals looked tasty, is all! But yeah, a bunch of girls have been really pushy with all that chi-blocking stuff...they never bothered me though! I think Fei Lin’s still mad at me from that time I told her her legs were too thick to wear my chenogsam correctly back when we were all training.”

Ty Lee wasn’t listening anymore; she was too busy watching Eyri’s impromptu force-feeding get interrupted by Fei Lin floating off her feet towards the center of the cafeteria. The massive Kiyoshi turned, revealing the strong, muscular arms of Daiyu, a rustic earth kingdom girl who was easily the best fighter of the Warriors next to Suki when she was at her prime. Despite the dress code being lifted, she wore the traditional Kiyoshi face paint; a white base with reds and orange around the eyes. She was a wholly good hearted girl, but packed a temper and a sense of personal justice that occasionally led her to clash with Suki’s strictly disciplined teaching style. She had clearly not been chi blocked; she was as fit as she ever was, which was strikingly so. Using only the strength of her arms she brought the roughly two hundred and fifty pound Fei Lin down onto a bench, causing her to flinch as her weight combined with Daiyu’s downward force bent the thick metal inward until it was a few inches above the ground. Her voice was mature and her words direct. “There. You sit here and stuff your own fat face, let everyone else worry about their own for once, yeah? I for one have to get to my triple shift hauling cargo up to the kitchens...and I think I will do so in my armor, which I still fit into.” There was more than a bit of insult in her tone. Fei Lin was clearly enraged and ready to lash out to salve her wounded ego, but it looked as if the ride on Daiyu’s shoulder upset her stomach. She got unsteadily to her feet, gave the fit Kiyoshi a withering glance, then stormed off to gorge herself. Eyri crept up to Daiyu, rubbing her distended stomach with one hand. “Thank you...you didn’t have to do that though...I really am kind of skinny...” Daiyu plucked at her now filthy robe. “If you’re hungry, eat. If you’re not, don’t.” she turned without looking at the chi-blocked little Eyri and strode out to the cargo bay, leaving the mess hall pin-drop silent for a long moment.

“Urp!” the entire mess hall turned to the source of the noise. Suki scratched at her oily cheek. “Hey, no fighting, okay?” Suki murmured as if both of the girls were still in the mess and standing next to her. “Come on, I want to get a nap in today, let’s finish the inspection...plus, Toph should have dinner ready for me soon” Suki said, a little more decisively. The Commander held up her saggy arms to let her compatriots lift her.
131321111111111111111111111111111111.title: Let the inspection begin!

1313211111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“One more stop, Suki!” Ty Lee scratched at her sticky, partially exposed breasts. Suki merely belched; she was stone tired from walking around the entire ship looking for problems she knew didn’t exist. As they descended down into the cargo bay where the majority of the surplus of food was stored, Suki’s pleasant thoughts were halted; a delicious smelling Kioyshi warrior had blocked their path. “Commander Suki!” Daiyu, clothes dirty from long hours in the cargo bay, was dripping with what smelled like a gravy of some sort. “I’m here to report Fei Lin for unsanctioned disciplinary action against other members of the Kiyoshi warriors,” her voice raised in pitch and volume dramatically as she continued, “ ...and for opening the valve on a tank full of gravy while I was pushing it across the cargo bay!” Suki made a gesture to her aides that she wanted to sit down. The small group of Kiyoshi that had been pandering to her since the mess hall stopped walking as their commander was brought down onto some comfortable-looking food crates. The plumper of the two set her down without a problem, but Eyri’s legs chose that moment to give out, sending her crashing down with the commander, pinned under her ripe underarm. “Oh...just be patient Eyri...” Suki decided, not feeling up for exercise as strenuous as lifting her arm. “Now, Daiyu, you’ve always been a little hasty in your accusations...” Suki began.

http://img217.imageshack.us/img217/6956/...

Daiyu grit her teeth and practically growled at the commander. “I knew it! You’re no better than any of them; I was stupid for even trying to settle this diplomatically! This is a ship full of coercive hogs!” Tasanee, who was watching events transpire a few dozen feet away next to Ty Lee, gestured towards the open doors to the cargo bay. “Look Ty Lee, here comes Fei Lin again with....wow, is that Maki? She’s really let herself go lately.” Ty Lee was concerned; the whole point of this chi blocking thing was to make everyone happy, not stressed! Daiyu continued her rant. “The only reason I’m not fatter than you right now is because I’m strong enough to defend myself against the mob of girls who have let themselves become complete hogs! The ultra-refined, large-hipped Athe made a disapproving noise. “A hog is an undignified creature, I resent that.” The kind-spirited Song chimed in as well, breathing heavily from all the stomach weight she was putting on. “Yeah, I understand Fei Lin can have a bad sense of humor sometimes, but is this really something to bug the commander about?” As if confirming Daiyu’s accusations, Athe succumbed to a fit of belches while Song proceeded to pour heavy cream into Suki’s waiting mouth at the sound of a sleepy murmur. “Commander, I’m giving you an ultimatum....you can....Commander! Wake up! I’m speaking to you!” The cream had made Suki sleepy, and she had fallen into a nap almost immediately after it stopped pouring down her gullet.
She started awake again, a stream of drool pattering onto her shirt. “What’s the problem, again?” she asked Daiyu.

Ty Lee watched the gravy-covered hellcat of a Kioyshi shoulder-check her way past Fei Lin, then disappear into the bowels of the ship.

----

Liu stumbled into the mess hall, where she knew Katara would likely be at this hour. She saw the massive waterbender gorging none too reluctantly on plate after plate of whatever food was ready and prepared from the kitchen; she wasn't very picky. "Katara! This is really bad; that girl I was telling you about, Daiyu, she just told off Suki...and now I think she's-"

Katara stopped stuffing her face, already guessing what Liu was going to say. "That's a terrible idea....a really, really terrible idea! -Urrap!- "

-----

Toph was savoring the myriad smells of her dinner-to-be, letting drool and sweat drip from her obese body freely. A series of hasty footsteps grew close, then suddenly the sound of her dinner being smashed, spilled, and otherwise being rendered less edible was all around her. An unfamiliar voice met her ears. "You're the one responsible for making Suki into a sack of dough, aren't you?" A furious girl asked.

"Yup!" Toph responded, proudly. "Got a problem with it? I really hope you do, since you just smashed my dinner." The mighty Earthbender wiggled her chubby toes eagerly and began to grin.
